Waited five minutes to have the drink order taken, then nachos came out cool.  Took forever to order dinner.  Food was fair.  Generic sauce on the linguini.  Was generally unimpressed.

I ate at Ava last night was not impressed with the service took almost 30 mins to get water and drinks, and it took the waiter nearly 20 mins from the time we got our drinks to ask us for our order. In the end the food was good and enjoyed the pork belly, So everything we had was good, just very disappointed with the service and having to wait an hour to be served our food. the owner was two booths from us and we saw he service was much better, so hopefully it just has to be with working out opening kinks.,

I travel a lot for business.  I have stayed at this hotel three separate times on business.  

I stayed for two nights with the family this April.  The entire experience was great - from check in to check out.  The staff (housekeepers, doormen, valets, managers and all) exhibited true hospitality.

In addition to great service in general, the care my daughter received was great.  My daughter has a peanut allergy - they took it very seriously at the restaurants on site.  The manager at Oyster Catchers made sure to notify the other restaurant managers at other on-site restaurants to make sure my daughter was safe.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday celebration and we both had a wonderful time! The food was delicious and service impeccable. We were served by Tyler B. who made spot on recommendations and did not rush as at all as we took our time through each course. He checked in often to make sure we were doing well and helped make the evening awesome! While all of the food was amazing, the bacon and the bread pudding were the two standouts for us. We'll definitely be back!

I sat at the bar, and the bar tender was amazing -- warm, friendly, helpful. He recommended a great beer (Black Abbey Rose). I had a classic cheeseburger and it was nothing special - just a normal cheeseburger. The truffle fries, on the other hand, were amazing. There are better burger places, I won't be back.

A group of 13, including myself, showed up for a late dinner on Saturday night and while we did expect a wait, we did not expect a 1.5-2 hr wait, considering there were two empty tables inside waiting to be cleared. It was not crowded I should add. The drinks were also a little overpriced, especially since that was pretty much the only option you had for a 2 hour wait. The staff would not allow one under 21 person in our group to stay and even be served just for dinner, so naturally we were all forced to leave AFTER we had already ordered a drink. Despite the staff being professional, we felt it was rude to force our entire party to leave since we had already committed to waiting the 1.5-2 hrs that was expected. We took our business across the street. While the food may be amazing here, I suggest not coming with a party of 2 or more unless you want to be tired, hangry, and spend at least $20 on drinks alone prior to even reading a dinner menu.

First let me say Joey was an amazing waiter!!! The food blahhhhhh literally. It had very little seasoning. I was so excited to go but the decor was underwhelming. The grouper picatta had no lemon flavor at all uhhhh ??? The swordfish had a strong flavor of nutmeg or some random "thanksgiving spice".  The boulabasse broth had absolutely no flavor.  So disappointing. My son had the Mac n cheese he had one bite and did not want anymore.  Joey took that off without being asked and that was super nice of him.  The appetizers were uneventful.  I checked it off my list and won't be back.

We stopped here one afternoon for lunch. The wait wasn't too bad and once we got seated the waitress came over as soon as we sat down. She took our drink orders and we each got a margarita. I asked for mine to be frozen. She brought us our waters and then took our orders. We waited and waited for our margaritas and they did not come. Our food came out and right after that our drinks finally came. We had waited 25 minutes for them. The waitress apologized and said that the bar was very busy. I agree the place was packed but people around us were all getting their drinks and we still had not gotten ours. And we didn't have anything "special" that should've taken that long. My drink was not frozen like I had asked. I asked our waitress about it and she said that the blender was down so they couldn't make it frozen. At this point I was just annoyed that it took 25 minutes to get it and then it was not even when I had ordered. We began to eat our food which was excellent!!! I had a taco salad (which I couldn't even finish it was so big and I can eat ALOT of food haha!!), my friend had fish tacos and she said they were great, and my husband had the seafood mac & cheese and  my sister had a burger that was very good. As we were eating the waitress brought over two different frozen margaritas that she thought I might like since I got a drink that I did not order. I was impressed that she did that. She left them there and just said for us to drink them all. We were very grateful that she did that. And the ones that she did bring were good! I cannot tell you the person who was playing music in there that afternoon but he was awesome! Very good at getting the crowd involved and the songs were great as well. All in all, besides waiting for drinks, it was a great experience!!

Came here with some friends and had some drinks (soda for me lol!) They seemed to enjoy their drinks, and bragged about how good the food is here. They ordered a cheese quesadilla, which honestly was not my favorite, the cheese tasted like those string cheese things...but aside from that our waiter was friendly and the restaurant was nice. They had big tv's all around with music videos, games, news etc. It was pretty packed which normally drives me crazy, but at this place seemed fitting...after baby is born, would return for drinks!

Awesme!  Pricey but Awesme !  I had the snapper over kale with halepeno butter. Dish was imaginative and had tons of flavor and fresh... Unusual menu with lots of creative flavors embracing southern flare .  Again prices were high, I paid 40+$ for just my dinner and a glass if wine (12.00) but I wld say well worth it .  If your looking for dishes with flare, imagination , flavor this is your place!

Great service. I had arrived earlier than my groups reservation, but the waiter had checked up on us very often and once my whole group had arrived the waitress who served us checked up on us just as much. They had accidentally made an order of Soy Style fried chicken instead of out ordered Spicy style. They gave it to us at no charge and also made an order of our originally ordered Spicy chicken. Good price for the portion of food as well for the price. Will definitely be back!

They have heavy cream for your coffee!
That, right there, makes this a 5 star establishment.

Paleo people, heads up!  real cream!
I ordered a 16 oz coffee this morning.
Requested heavy cream..

It was absolutely delicious and not Starbuck prices.
Paleo/Ketogenic/Primal humans.. This place is worth a visit!

You're welcome.

Came on a Sunday for brunch. First impression was confusion with two entrances and people did not know where the line formed. If you want to order breakfast, coffee, wine, you stand in the front line. If you want to order a salad, walk to the back of the restaurant. If you want to order prepared foods for later, walk to the back of the restaurant. No signage or direction was really given.

Ordered the fried prosciutto sandwich with spinach and poached egg with a side of parmesan potatoes. The hizzy (husband) got the brunch burrito and jalapeno grits. I asked for hot sauce and was told to go to the front to get it. Very inconvenient. They only have ONE bottle of hot sauce for the whole restaurant by the entrance. Not even by the eating area. And it was empty.  While my fresh food sat at the table 75 feet away, I had to wait for someone to refill that bottle. Like had to go to the back and refill. No extra bottles anywhere. The sides were both delicious! Although, jalapeno grits need some spice. I tasted no jalapeno. False advertisement. The potatoes were yum. My sandwich was less than desirable. Not very flavorful. The burrito was very good! Meat filled and a good blend of flavors. Prices were affordable. The huz thought they could have charged more for the burrito, but was happy they did not.

The chairs and tables are so pretty, but the chairs are too short for the tables. Now, I am short so this is exaggerated for someone like me. My husband who is almost 6' tall felt the same way. He actually mentioned it first. It is nice to have pretty decor, but utility should be first for a restaurant. We did not like the flow of the space. That line is really blocking the rest of the restaurant off. It was just awkward. 

Parking is definitely an issue, but if I lived close by, I would totally walk in for a salad or prepared meal. Just be prepared to drop some cash. $13/pound under 3 lbs of purchase for the prepared foods. $11/lb if over 3 lbs. Whole foods and Turnip Truck is almost half this price for the prepared foods. 

Maybe dinner would be a better experience?

phat bites is okay. 2 phat, the smaller counterpart, is actually way better. the fruit tea was very watered down, the portions of the chicken salad in the ninja star weren't as generous at this location, and the staff was less enthused about my business. I'll keep going to 2 phat instead for the same food.

Awesome atmosphere. Excellent selection of craft beers. They have standard everyday craft brews as well as different selections frequently, always leaving you a reason to come back. 

The food is tasty and the menu has been updated recently. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming.

I have been to IHB many times and look forward to my next visit.

One of the best Tapas restaurant we've had !! Three muses have a fairly small tapas menu but no doubt all of them are good. This visit we got to try 7 of the tapas dishes and they were all great! My favorites are the Moroccan eggplant bruschetta, Bacon wrapped stuffed dates, and the Beer-braised pork belly (how can one go wrong with bacon?). Service was great and we really enjoyed the live music.

The Bourse is a beautiful building inside and outside...

But, it's just a glorified food court..  Nothing "local"... It's all mall chain restaurants.  None are very good...

You're not missing much if you skip the Bourse...

Great local spot! Service was awesome, food was great. I ordered the cheeseburger omelet and my boyfriend got the country breakfast...they both def hit the spot. Probably one of the best breakfast mom and pop places we've visited. We'll visit again if we find ourselves around this area.

My fiance took me to R2L for my birthday. I cannot speak more highly of the ambiance of this restaurant! Even on a cloudy and rainy night, the view was to die for! Why aren't there more restaurants like this in the city?! All of the tables were spaced far apart from one another... unlike most places where they try to squeeze as many tables in as possible and you feel like you're sharing your dinner with the strangers next to you! The seats were comfy couches and perfectly placed around the room to face the windows overlooking the city.  

To start our meal we ordered a Caesar salad and the crab cake appetizer. The salad was VERY salty and the crab cake was only so-so (not a whole lot of crab). For our meals, he ordered the fillet and I got the stripped bass. The fillet was VERY good and perfectly prepared. My striped bass had a great flavor to it! It was pared with a scallop, some mixed veggies, and a square unknown fatty substance. I later looked over the menu description and realized that was the "fresh bacon"! It was a good 3 inches thick of fat! The rest of the items on the plate made up for the fat though! 

I don't have much to praise about our server.  He was strangely quiet and made it a bit of an akward encounter. 

All in all the atmosphere was amazing and we will definitely be back again... hopefully on a clear night!

Defined lines and smooth curves.  They slip into your conversation. Communal seating, resting, eating. 
The crew is well prepared to listen.  
Delicia, delightful.
Knowledge in food is a wonderful thing.  Sharing the preparation and gift of that knowledge elevates everyone's dine time. 
-Raised stone benches with sturdy bolsters
-Simple rounds of 6-8 tables
-A smattering of stand alone tables
-Skinny beams and full glass

All are reflective of the effort leading to a fantastic dining experience, or tasting a better than average margarita.  They're close to 20,000 margaritas and close to their 1 year anniversary.  Who's the lucky person to taste that one?
Me, I was lucky to pass the Beet Pastelito between my lips.  Supposedly it had a little too much chile.  I liked the finish of the small cake, but agree the normal diner might feel a delightful shock above average. 
Love the beets...

Came here not just once but twice during a quick trip to NOLA. As a vegetarian the kale salad and mac and cheese were so delicious, and there were also a lot of meat options for my partner. The ambiance and music were also perfect and made me feel like I had an authentic NOLA experience. Also some great mixed drinks!

Not a big area to play.. a lot smaller than the one in Houston.. Fun to play but they have got to get the odors dealt with. It sometimes smells like a toilet.. Also wouldn't recommend eating there as it's way too loud.. Food area is too close to the games.. With kids it's way too chaotic..

Great little local restaurant. We sat on the front patio to catch the full moon rise last night. Unfortunately, it rose off the back of the restaurant. Christina, the hostess came to find us and let us know the moon was rising out the back. Friendly, helpful staff, & great food. This is the kind of place that's indicative of the friendly Santa Barbara locals. Also a good place to visit at Christmas. They always do beautiful decorations.

I was crunched for time and wandered in around 2:30pm.  The staff was very friendly.  I asked about ingredients - I unfortunately can't eat dairy.  They made sure the sauce I had was dairy free and gave me a side sauce of honey mustard just in case.  The food was DELICIOUS! I had the crab and and shrimp sandwich - I would travel back to NOLA just for the sandwich.

We ordered online. Picked up. Everything we had was good. Burgers chicken sandwich onion rings and fries. 
We're going back.  The lettuce and tomato was very fresh on the sandwiches. 
Ordering online was the best. Our order was ready when promised. They are busy and don't take orders over the phone. They also have a lesser chance of making an error.
I'm a huge Bellacino's fan and this location does not disappoint. My only recommendation would be to eat in or carry out, do not order delivery.

This Syberg's has a lot to offer and they just recently remodeled to make it look more classy in the dining area. 

They not only have great food, but they offer a shuttle for $2 each way to all Blues games. I have used this service a few times and it's nice not to have to pay for parking and be dropped off at the front door of Scottrade. 

They also have Karaoke on Friday and Saturday nights which is always a fun time. Great happy hour specials and nightly specials except for Saturdays are also a huge plus! The only negative I can think of is that parking is a pain due to it being in a hotel. 

They had a huge post St. Pat's parade celebration where they had the local band "Joe Dirt" playing in the parking lot. Awesome time! 

I have some great memories here at Syberg's and I will be back.

My first time and what an amazing treat. The empanadas were amazing and I ordered the pork tenderloin which was cooked to perfection. I also had the carriage house margarita which was yummy. Everything was wonderful including our very helpful and knowledgeable server Miriam! I will definitely be back
Steaks are ok but pricey.  The bisque was terrible.  Bread was good.  Haven't been back.

We had reservations for a party of 8 on a Monday night. I arrived right at 7pm on the dot, and was please to find most of my friends had already been seated. I have been to a few other M Street restaurants in Nashville, including Saint Añejo, their building neighbor. I came in with high expectations, and they were definitely met. 

I didn't catch our servers name, otherwise I would be giving her the shout-out she deserves. She was wonderful. She was always 2-steps ahead of us with everything.

They have a huge drink list, it was almost overwhelming. I ended up opting for a glass of white wine. It was fantastic.

In contrast to their drink options, they have a tiny food menu. I even checked the back of the menu only to find a blank sheet (whoops). I feel like if you are going to have a tiny food menu, every single thing you offer better be WOW. I ended up ordering a Spaghetti Pomodoro and an order of brussel sprouts. The waitress told me that the sides were definitely a sharing portion, but I love brussel sprouts. I opted to go solo. The food here is fantastic. 

After a glass of wine, brussel sprouts, Spaghetti Pomodoro, and a tip, my meal ended up being just over $50. Would I come here on a weekly basis? Absolutely not. Moto is a great place for splurging for a special occasion.

Love this place!  Salads and sandwiches are amazing.  Fresh.  Only two reasons the review is not five stars.  It's operating hours, it closes too early and isn't open on Sunday and it's always so crowded you sometimes have a hard time finding a seat.
But, it is totally worth a try.  Service is helpful and friendly.

Great Service!

We had the Monday special "lobster bake", although it was very good, the seafood was sparse.  Well worth the $25 special, but not worth the regular menu price of $39.  Our server was Shane, and the service we received from him was excellent!!

I was here recently for dinner. The food was so satisfying I can't give it less than 5 stars. I had baby back ribs, fries, and mac n cheese. I also tried some of a pulled pork sandwich, which is actually cubed pork. Everything was great. 

My only critique is that they need more signage outside. I've driven past this place a lot, but didn't even notice it until someone pointed it out.

I ended up here with some girlfriends by complete accident during its opening weekend. We were gonna go to a place around the corner, but the line was out the door. We still had to wait about 45 minutes at Milk & Honey, but it didn't take crazy long. The service was mediocre. I ordered a Coke to drink, and I had to remind our waitress 2x before she brought it out. She was really nice - just not the most reliable. And our food took forrreevvveerrrr to come out. I realize that it was opening weekend, and they are still working out the kinks in service and such. The food was good. I honestly cannot remember the name of what I ordered, but it was a biscuit sandwich. The biscuit was to die for - it was so delicious. I also got a side of potatoes, and those - well, I had very high hopes for them and most of them were cold on the inside. I didn't even say anything because it took so long for our good to be delivered. If I am ever back in the Nashville area, I would like to try it again to see if it has improved since the opening. I have high hopes for it.

I actually met the owner Brian Flowers before he opened Tabletop Café, as he was advertising himself at a POGOB boardgame meetup event. I'm pleased to find that the TTC is well-spaced, adequately lit, if a bit overly warm and lacking temperature control (if you're a thin guy like me that spews BTUs, you'll die in the summer months!). Spacious hardwood tables greet you as you walk in, with reservations available. You sign up at the counter and are free to float between tables, with your entry fee and all consumables paid for at the end of your visit.

The most attractive feature of TTC is the large boardgame collection as well as the flat $5/day for all-day gaming ($2.50/hr at rival Hexagon Café on Whyte). The customer service is efficient and polite, but not necessarily friendly. Orders may not be taken from tables generally. You must make your way up to the counter and interrupt play (or hope there isn't a queue after taking your turn in your game). 

Long hours (up to 1am on Friday and Saturday night) are quite a delight as you may choose whenever is convenient for you to go solo or with a group of friends. Despite my belief that this out of the way location would be an issue for most gamers (as many are not vehicle owners), I was pleasantly surprised that the location is only a 5 minute walk from a #8 stop. 

As with most boardgame cafés, TTC suffers from more emphasis on the boardgame and not enough on the café. Overpriced and undersized portions for all food (as well as lacking diversity), though I found it of good quality and quite edible (of course, outside drinks and food are not permitted. Just like movie concession, this is where they make their money!) 

All in all, a fun hangout place at great prices, just eat before you go or head out for a meal and come back to more gaming afterwards!
Nothing special. Eggs were not prepared as requested, biscuit was dry. Service was fine. $20 for "classic" breakfast of eggs, bacon, grits, biscuit & gravy and soda - pretty steep in my opinion.

Decided to check out the local fare and found myself and a pretty good place. There was no hostess so I seated myself and was promptly served with menu and drink. I ordered the BBQ burger and fries. It was really good. I was afraid of the trend toward frozen burger patties and luckily they aren't using them yet or are good enough at making them have flavor. The fries were seasoned and yummy. The atmosphere was typical sports bar, but the service was perfect. The waitresses seemed to really try to make sure everyone had what they needed and each of them asked me how I was when they walked by at least once.

Would definitely recommend to people looking for a good burger and a decent selection of beers. They also have a decent variety of food to choose from outside of burgers, so those looking for something more will be pleased too.

Found these folks thanks to restaurant.com, and I must say, it was a winner!  Great little place, but not the easiest to find.  You have to be looking for it to find it, but worth the trek.  The hand tossed pizza was terrific, as were the breadsticks.  The atmosphere is very nice, and family friendly.   Service was good - not especially fast, but no complaints.  Beer selection is pretty decent - usual domestics, and a couple of nice specialty beers.  Will definitely return, as I would like to see this one stick around for a while.
Grilled Salmon with Asparagus & Mashed Potatoes exquisitely prepared!

Had dinner at an old stand by. Things have changed at Olive Garden. Had the peach bellini tea and discovered it does not come with a piece of peach anymore. The look of the menu has changed some. The service was good and the dining area was clean. As usual, the parking lot was full and the place was busy. Lots of families. 

The table had an electronic device where you could place drink, food (for kids), call the server, play games. Be careful though, you will be charged for playing the trivia game. I like the ability to pay with your credit card at the table. I'm always wary when the servers take my credit card. 

Olive Garden has remained consistent with the quality of their food and service. They don't give the after dinner mints either. Change? Don't like it.

I am staying at the Extended Stay while working the Sandy storm ( I am an adjuster) and was told Baxter's was a great place to eat.  I ordered the Fish and Chips while my co-worker ordered a burger. Service was slow as the place was filling up at the bar with the Friday night crowd.  When our orders came I was disappointed.  My Fish and Chips were frozen fish sticks (filets) and my co-workers burger was a frozen "BubbaBurger". I am a food snob and I expect a local restaurant to sever fresh food. Obviously the locals don't go there to eat, just drink.

Saw this on yelp, so thought I'd give it a try.
I had the BLT. Good sandwich. A little unorthodox on beverages but was good. Wife had biscuits and gravy and was really good!
It's on my list to visit again, next time in Boise.

Homemade! So good! I ordered the avocado toast and it was perfect portion and light! So good! 
My son had the steak sandwich which is a favorite on the menu and he loved it! Definitely a must try!

We had high hopes for this place but we found the burgers just average. Here you can custom order your burgers with whatever you want on it. I had a pretty standard burger with swiss, lettuce, ketchup, mustard, mayo and to add a bit of a twist-roasted corn. The buns were average-a little too big for my liking. The taste of the burger was pretty good but again, nothing too special. Not sure if we'll be back for a second round. There are so many other better options out there.

With the title being "American Social" that isn't the case.    There is no place to just "social".  There needs to be a place where you can just hang out and just "social".   It's more of a restaurant than a social gathering.

A great staple of media. The sushi is fresh and innovative. The specials and main menu items are always delicious. We always enjoy a byob on media. The restaurant is very small however we never had to wait for a table so can't complain! Fast service with great recommendations from the staff.

A culinary tour de creole! I stayed at the Hilton for a business meeting in New Orleans and my associate made a reservation at Lüke raving about the place. Naturally, I was skeptical. 

The restaurant is on the ground floor of the Hilton in St. Charles St. in downtown "Nawlins'," as it's called. I'm from Ohio -- so, needless to say, I was on the search for some great creole and cajun food.

It was fantastic!!! We had a small group, so we started with the cold seafood platter with oysters, clams, crab, shrimp, and mussels; and an assortment of pate, cheese and bread. WOW. Obviously the fresh oysters were fresh from the gulf -- you could taste it! The texture was light and ever-so-slightly salty. The other seafood was okay, so if I had to choose again, I'd just get more oysters. Great cold seafood bar! The rabbit pate was pretty good too, so be adventurous and try a few different items!

I had recently made Shrimp and Grits at home, therefore decided to see what they actually tasted like in New Orleans. Not bad - mine were better. I think it's mostly because I liked my grits a little creamier. Theirs were lumpy and slightly dry. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and seasoned with what tasted like a little blackened seasoning. I prefer a more tomato and garlic approach. Nonetheless, they were still tasty and delicious.

Again, since I was jonesin' for some cajun food, I had a cup of seafood gumbo as a side. Whoooowheeee, awesome!  It was very flavorful and had a decent amount of seafood. The bowl was completely empty... 

The service was impeccable on the Monday night I visited. The server was attentive and very helpful with recommendations. 

I recommend you sit in the back of the place near the kitchen, which is enclosed on 3 sides by glass, so you can see all the action! Charming ambiance that makes it appropriate for a dinner for two or a business dinner as well.

So far the service has not been good at all.  Here with a group of 9 and it took forever to order and get appetizers and drinks.  After complaining services picked up. Food subpar Italian won't come back.  Fish dish should be healthy-NOT

Excellent barbeque. Loved the mac and cheese and the ribs (short rib and pork ribs) which I'd recommend over the brisket (which was good, but not quite as good). They also give you cheese fries if you check in which were awesome.

Good place to go eat and relax...

Food on the restaurant side is good and it can be served on the bar side.
No BBQ on bar side though but everything else is A-OK!.
good place to have a few drinks and hang out with friends. food is a little pricey but its a bar...

only down parts would be the crowd is a little intimidating. and the bar smells like cigarettes, when you leave you will smell like it too.

otherwise this place is an awesome place overall. i would go back enjoy yourselves here if you don't mind the little stuff i listed. i really don't either.

Just wanted to update my still stellar review for honegrow with two suggestions and a compliment to Amed the manager who stops to talk to folks appropriately and is genuinely concerned about cutomers experiences. He noticed that I have eaten here twice a day and we got to talking. His family was there eating as mine was and he is extremely professional in a most personal way. OK two suggestions. Staff, announce loudly, "Welcome to honeygrow!" even when it's my 50th time there. I should be welcoming them since they know the place less than I do since they obviously don't recognize me as the most frequently seen patron. So I'm just asking that corporate tones that down a bit? It's not just that I'm off put by it but half the people coming into honeygrow are in conversation while walking in or on their phones (their prerogative) and its actually mildly disruptive. Greeting customers a certain way shouldn't be a corporate policy unless you fine tune it a bit. Ask greeters to be a little more diplomatic in their approach. The store is loud because of the layout which is no problem but it results in having greeters shout out, "Welcome to honeygrow!" See how saying, "Welcome to honeygrow!" gets old quickly just by hearing it or seeing it written over and over in this review. Just sayin'...OK one other more amusing pet peev. So in the men's bathroom there is a nice braille sign that says, of course, "Employees must wash hands." No problem with that, I  assume it's a health code thing. But hilarious is the fact that the sign is framed and encased in glass. Hoping you get the irony but apparently not. Blind people can't read braille if the sign is covered in glass. Do I have to spell that out. Here it is in braille, "Blind people can't read braille covered in glass." Welcome to honeygrow! I'm just teasing you honeygrow and I know you can take it because you're a great restaurant and you're going places and you've mastered the market of bringing slow food to fast food. Damn I should have gone into advertising. There's a slogan in there somewhere. John Watson the father of Psychology made millions on Madison Ave after his successful career as a psychologist. As an addiction psychologist in Bala Cynwyd if I get tired of my day job helping people with drug and alcohol addiction I'll go into advertising or restaurant ergonomics or at least writing reviews. So last piece to the long winded story. I did share my concerns about the blind patrons in the men's room and an earnest and well meaning employee suggested that you couldn't work at a place like honeygrow if you were blind because it requires an ability to handle many small items of food and preparation and hot stove cooking. He may be right but I wondered whether that would be discrimination. Maybe a blind person reading this review could weigh in on this? Keep rockin' the Slow to Fast Food world!

Went on a Tuesday @ 7pm.  The inside is decorated very nicely.  I had one of the sandwiches as did my dinner partner.  The food was just okay, nothing special.  However the deserts are to die for.  Will definitely be back for the desert.  Two people food+drinks+dessert came to around $50.

So I walk in there's and there's three people at the bar. I set down and the bartenders on the other side of the bar I sat there for a few minutes and two guys came in and she came over and served them beers got them menus. The bartender then proceeds to check on a table and get their checks and bring them up and ring them up right in front of me at the cash register. I thought maybe she say something then. Nope takes the change back over to the table comes back stops at the two guys on the other side of me asking if they want another beer (one stool between me and them). Turned around and walked across in front of me and proceeded to go back and check her phone.  I should have known when there's only a dozen or so cars in the parking lot at 6 o'clock in Indy that this place was definitely hit and miss. Needless to say I'm heading out to the next restaurant and won't be back.

This place is pretty much the epitome of a great dive bar. The drinks are cheap, the atmosphere is unpretentious, the staff is friendly, did I mention the drinks? but seriously, where else can you get a 40 and not get a strange look from a single person in the bar?

I went here about 5 years ago and as far as I can remember, I was obsessed. I went for the 2nd time a couple days ago and was not happy. 

Pros from the experience: 1. Mimosa was nice and strong and 2. my boyfriend's breakfast bread bowl was good (although a little low on the sausage)

Cons from the experience: 1. The server was slow and only came by the table 3 times: to take our order, give our food, and give the check. 2. The bub holes (homemade donut holes) were forgotten, so we reminded a random waiter because we didn't see ours. When the check came, the waitress charged us for the bub holes even though we didn't get them. When I mentioned we never got the bub holes, she said "well they should be coming out soon." so we waited....and finally they came out (assuming she forgot to put in the order). When we tried them, they were rock hard. Donuts should not be rock solid. 3. I asked for an over-easy egg on the side and it came completely cooked through. Dipping the sausage in the yolk is the best part! 4. When the waitress asked how we liked it, I told her we waited a little too long for the donut holes. She didn't even apologize...she just said "yeah well they take a while." 

Not impressed. There are many other breakfast areas that I will try out. I had this huge built up idea in my head from my first experience many years ago, so I'm sure that increased the let-down. 

TL;DR- bad service, rock hard donut holes, and incorrectly cooked food.

This location is an interesting one, you almost miss it. Not the best place to dine in; not much hot sauce, utensils are given out. They run out of donuts fast though so definitely get your butt in here early.

Exceptionally delicious food, good portions, friendly staff, good service, great atmosphere and location. I had the turkey Brie on focaccia and took 1/2 home. My husband had the black bean soup which was equally delicious and hearty with beef in it.

Respect is earned, not bought and philly dawgz has earned my respect. I came strolling in to satisfy my hunger and decided to try the chicken nuggets and fries. By the way, Philly Dawgz has a wide array options to choose from starting from: 1) Hot Dogs 2) Italian beef 3)Austin BBQ and ending with latin flavors. The prices are reasonable, the food.........delicious. I always see others look at the menu in the front, then walk away. MISTAKE! I strongly encourage coming here to try delicious food at a great price.  They offer a Daily $5 deal which includes 2 hot dawgz with any toppings (toppings are free!) and a pepsi. Their kind and warm, friendly environment has earned my permanent respect and I regard Philly Dawgz as one of the best fast-food joints in Philadelphia. Therefore, I'll give Philly Dawgz a 5 star rating!!!!!!

Service: Excellent; doesn't get much better than Harry & Izzy's.
Food: Excellent, with a small imperfection.
Drinks: Excellent.

Harry & Izzy's blew me away. My friend and I came here for dinner while in Indianapolis on a girls' weekend trip. We were seated immediately on a Friday night with no reservations. The place is pretty big.

Our server was incredible. She was so attentive (but no overly so), gave us the best recommendations and was extremely sensitive to my friend's gluten allergy. Side note: Everyone here is super accommodating about food allergies. After we told our server that my friend had an allergy, someone came by to make sure that was the only allergy. Then, a manager came by to ensure the same thing (and the manager brought out the food!).

I ordered the blueberry old fashioned, which was on point (and had plenty of booze!). Highly recommend.

For food, we ordered the Grilled Slab Bacon for an appetizer. No, literally, that is the name of the dish. It's a slab of bacon. And it was the BEST thing I have ever eaten. No joke. Do yourself a favor, and get this. We are still talking about the slab of bacon days later.

I ordered the grilled salmon as my entree and upgraded my side to the brussels sprouts. Salmon was cooked perfectly, and the brussels sprouts did not disappoint! The only thing that did disappoint a bit was my friend's filet. She ordered it medium rare, and it came out medium, maybe even medium well. I'm sure that's not something that happens often there.

super customer service from the time i placed my order on the phone ending with picking up my food.  businesses have to understand that the food can be great but a bad experience with customer service can turn people off.  but the guy who took my order & took care of me at pick up was awesome.  staff were hustling filling orders not missing a beat.  rolls that steaks and hoagies come on are so damn good!!!!  chicken cheesesteak was great!  fries crispy!  did i mention the rolls?????  the best!
Fabulous! Creative tastes. Small plates. Excellent, attentive service. Reasonably priced. Intimate setting, but energetic. Mushroom sandwich blew us away! Try the broccoli rabe Bruschetta too.

This place is a disaster. The menu is horribly overpriced and is poor quality. Their in-house soda is good but again it is terribly overpriced. They nickel and dime you on the side dishes and burger toppings. Don't ever go to any of these in the chain. Yikes!

This may be one of the last bastions for smokers who miss the days of lighting up whereever and whenever they wanted... I would recommend that the casino spend some of the earnings from myself and others and invest in a new ventilation system, cause the cigarette/cigar smoke here is horrendous.  I've been to Vegas and Atlantic City before and no where is the smoke this bad....

Besides the smoke, it is nice for Tampa to have such a nice entertainment complex with plenty of bars and restaurants along with a very cool hotel.  I liked that they expanded the gaming options, have plenty of food options, a dedicated poker room, and plenty of parking.  Most of the casino floor, like most other casinos is full of slot machines and other gaming machines.  There aren't that many table games but probably just enough as they're usually completely full.  

I've had dinner at the buffet (Fresh Harvest) and the sushi place (Rock N' Raw Bar), both places offer an enjoyable "less smokey" area and a great selection of food all reasonably priced and pretty good... Really besides the cigarette and cigar smoke, I'd probably come here more often...
The food wasn't very good. I have no idea why there's currently 4.5 stars. The wings were the best but not great. The Greek food was way below average. Yelp rarely lets me down but it did this time.

Way foo tight quarters and overcrowded - although the service was good considering the crowded conditions but the much vaunted "Pizza Margherita" did not live up to what I'm accustomed to in a Margherita - after living in Napoli for a number of years maybe I expected too much but I was disappointed with this pizza.  As noted, the service was fine and the Arugula salad was very good but........cannot possibly give more than three stars because of the less than outstanding pizza and the very crowded space.

Sub quality pub food. Nachos were disgusting. Booths were dirty and waitress was rude. It's a shame because this would be a great little spot. I love dive bars so long as the food is on point and unfortunately this place falls short.

Literally the best gourmet donuts I've ever had! They're perfect! I'm usually a plain Jane glazed donut person, but here it's so worth it to try out their different kinds. They have something new to offer every day. I have only had their donuts; never any sliders, kolaches, biscuits, etc.
They serve white and chocolate milk on tap, which is so cool to me. I am not a coffee person, but my husband says their espresso is too bitter.
They're usually pretty busy, so sometimes it's hard to find a seat. The line is often long, but they can usually roll them through pretty quickly.

I am a really big fan of this place.

Their food is pretty good and the beer is great.

I love the atmosphere. Its a great place to watch a game or just relax with a flight and play shuffleboard. 

Barrio is a must try on the Tucson beer circuit.
Great brunch and cocktails! The Nooner, Roasted Peppers and Squash, and Blueberry Waffles were great. Very good Bloody Mary, red sangria, and signature craft cocktails.

Let me start off with the service was 5 star quality since walking into the place. Really friendly staff. They are on top of your needs without being to aggressive. I ordered a $22.00 special and it comes with a free Margarita and since I don't drink and declined  my server said he would give me dessert in its place.

Tried Mole enchiladas for the first time and it was pretty good, thick acquired taste.

Chili relleno was huge and stuffed with delicious melted cheese. 

This place is a must Visit when traveling through Tucson. Everything was fresh down to the chips and salsa..

Chink's is small and maybe a bit out of the way, but the food is freshly made and the service is friendly. They have good cheesesteaks, good fries, and good drinks (including a variety of ice-cream sodas and flavored cokes). Go during off hours if you want to get a booth.

Just like the description, EATS serves up classic American food and huge American portions. 
The homemade hot potato chips with spicy dip was a nice surprise and VERY addicting. Not a place to go if you are watching your waistline...

We ordered the chili, which was just right,not too spicy but can be doctored up with Tabasco to taste. It was heavier on the beans than the beef but the tomato sauce was delicious. My partner had a classic wedge which was smothered with fresh bacon bits, chopped tomato and blue cheese. Perfect!
I decided to order one of their signature specialties,, the bite me back shrimp salad and I am sorry to say that it was disappointing (which is why I gave them three stars.)

According to the menu, this is an original appetizer created by accident by the owner in the kitchen. It consists of Cajun style spicy popcorn shrimp fried over greens,chopped cucumbers and tomatoes and shredded cheese. The spice was too salty and the rest of the salad ho-hum. Iceberg is pretty boring unless it's a wedge. I also did not care for the processed shredded cheese smothering the salad. I would prefer gorgonzola, blue or goats cheese and larger shrimp.

Despite the disappointing entree, the sandwiches and burgers that were delivered to the other tables looked great. 

We'll just have to go back and try more entrees!
Decided to give it a second tries and I think it's much better this time. The waitresses are polite and food is quick.
The landmark is a fun place to go they always have special going on just avoid the DJ night if you don't like loud music. Drinks are good food is decent.

This place is really nice and they have two small tables outside, which is nice. We ordered a latte and lox bagel sandwich. Latte was really good, but lox sandwich had two small pieces of smoked salmon and invaded by tomatoes, which is not the way it should be. Thats why 3 stars.

Great service, meh food. My steak and shrimp were both undercooked, asparagus overcooked, garlic mash was dry. Draught beer was good as was dessert...but I can hit a pub for a less expensive pint and DQ for dessert.

Give it a miss.

I helped all the places that did Sonoran hot dogs and BK tacos had them I'm glad I went there it was good but what they had was queso fundido .....chorizo and melted cheese this place was so busy but the service moved right along definitely worth going there especially since I looked for you Sly dog and it didn't even exist

We walked in as a party of 7 and sat on the outside patio overlooking the Mississippi River! From the time we walked in, to the time we left, we had nothing but positive vibes from the whole experience!! The food was good, but our server Fernandez was absolutely AMAZING!!! I hope management recognizes what an amazing person they have working for them! Will definitely return when I come back to NOLA!!!

This place isn't much to look forward to, in my opinion. I came here in hopes to get a good sandwich and a quiet atmosphere to read my book. The prices were a little steep, kind of the same compared to other sandwich places around town. Their service wasn't too great, much the same as fast food, especially Carl's Jr. and - sorry for repeating myself - other sandwich places in the area. Atmosphere needs to be worked on. It didn't feel as homely, and there's someone screaming "Need a runner please!" twice a minute, which could drive you crazy. To me, it would serve them better to have a smaller place and more of a to-go service so that this would be acceptable.
Excellent food, but more seating would be nice.  The smashed potatoes were amazing, and my biscuit was crispy and light both!  I would definitely go back, as the food was very good.

Came in here with a large group of girls a few weeks ago and was very pleased, aside from a few issues. 

First let me say, the prices are amazing. Unfortunately I don't think I got a pick a of the prices, but basically you get about an 8-10 inch pizza with all the toppings of your choice, for about $9. The kids pizzas come with drinks and are about $5 give or take. The time to actually cook your pizza is magical as well. Yes, I know I said magical lol. Basically as you are paying your pizza will probably be completed. I have no idea how they do it but they do and it's really heaven. 

So my daughter had the standard cheese pizza which was good. Pepperoni was too. I had the meats option which was tasty as well. We also tried this pizza with chicken, white sauce, mozzarella, artichokes, pesto, and garlic (oh btw, get the garlic. Get lots of it. Trust me on this). This pizza was so out of the norm for my normal pizza but it was so good! 

Honestly, to me the only thing that could've been better was the customer service. There was one particular guy, I think he may have been a manager, that was just going way too fast. Like, I get that it's a fast place, but don't be so rushed while I give you my ingredients that you end up putting something on my pizza that I didn't want. Also, he seemed to have an attitude while speaking with customers. Customer service can sometimes be what makes or breaks an establishment...id hate to see this awesome pizza shop get broken by funky customer service. Thankfully everyone wasn't that way. 

Overall, id love to come back!

I'll give it four stars, just my average of a good atmosphere & service, with average food. My kids immediately started drawing on the chalkboard. That was a nice touch that I haven't seen in a restaurant before. Excellent craft beer selection featuring many local brews. The kids' menu is limited to only pizza or penne pasta. Pizza lacked flavor, the sauce just wasn't very zesty. I would go back and try a salad or pasta next time, and give another shot to a different variety of pizza.

Manny is the King of Broad Street. He has great food and he cares about everyone that walks into the restaurant. He is also very involve in the community. Friday nights is always a favorite night to dine there. Great seafood bisque soup and love his famous pizza dip.

The Market is going downhill, recently I went and they were selling Costco muffins in the baked goods. After I wrote a complaint, they started carrying Frogs Bakery stuff, which is ok but overpriced. The last few times I've been there the food in the hot grab and g section has been soggy (burritos in tin foil) or burned (pizza). I do like the farmer's market on Saturdays though, especially the little baby goats the soap guy brings.

I had probably the best sandwich ever here, but the customer service leaves something to be desired. The two gentlemen behind the counter were accommodating and courteous but the lady at the register was crude, offensive, and beyond unprofessional. When there was a mixup over our order, she stomped outside and yelled "I'm gonna punch this bitch," (and other expletives) to the customers dining outside. For that reason alone, I will never dine here again unless the management seriously reconsiders the individuals representing their brand.

For the past several weeks Wednesdays our boys night out. We have come here for happy hour specials. The staff the bartender and waitresses have been so very nice. Food is very tasty. I love their fish tacos, chicken wings, pizza and chicken parmesan. We will be trying most of the stuff on the menu. You must try for dessert their funnel cake fries with Caramell and ice cream. So very good.

Good place, good beer, good food, good music, good service (Kelly)!! 
Highlights: homemade fresh bread, tender amazing brisket, delicious salads, tasty stout, good IPA. Highly recommend!

Great quick dinner. Got the pulled pork and fried egg. Totally delicious!!
Great French Onion soup too!

Having grown up in Santa Barbara and enjoyed many evenings at this restaurant, we took my parents here for dinner the day after Thanksgiving and were very disappointed in the lack of warmth or welcome in the service which was capable but very mechanical. Then, after dinner and paying the check, we were talking when Jason came up and informed us that we needed to vacate the table because someone else had it reserved.  We had been there a little over an hour and a half and paid $250 for drinks and dinner. I asked to speak to the manager and the owner (who apparently is new and doesn't care about repeat business) met me at the door (in sloppy jeans and a tee shirt) and informed me that there was fine print at the bottom of the menu that says they have a 90 minute policy for tables!  I pointed out that there were other open tables and he said that other people wanted our specific booth. He was belligerent and unapologetic and offered nothing to compensate us for a bad evening at his restaurant.  Having dined at restaurants literally all over the world I can say that this is a first and we will not go back which is sad for all the employees in the kitchen who still make a great chicken piccata.

Had mother's day buffet today very nice enjoyable time. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Wide selection of good tasting food and absolutely the best omelets I have ever had.  This is the second year we have enjoyed this buffet and I would recommend it to anyone. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.

Amazing fish tacos!!! - as good as any Southern California ones we've ever had --which is saying something from a Californian! Great flavor on the hot chicken tacos too. great spot all around...wine list is decent and the service was friendly and attentive.

I ate here for the first time last weekend, and I was super impressed! I had been up in Santa Barbara, and everything was annoyingly crowded up there, so just by chance I happened to stop off here on my way back down to Ventura. The place was cozy, and everyone seemed to know each other, which is always a good sign at an Italian place (regulars equal good food!). I got the avocado sub, which was surprisingly good for a quick little sub. It did have mayonnaise on it, which I wasn't too happy with, because the menu didn't specify it for that sub, while it did for all the other subs, but none the less, it still tasted delicious! It came with a side salad which was good too (just be aware, the side salad comes with salami unless you specify you don't want it!). All in all, I was very happy; good service, great location, yummy food, and all just a quick hop off the freeway!
SOOO GOOD! Get the maple bacon breakfast sandwich. It's so good. And the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Breakfast

They had the standard continential breakfast. You can also get room service and order food 

The breakfast was better then average and everything was fresh.

We order food from Szechuan Lei Lei every week or so. We have only had their food delivered, so I cannot comment on the restaurant itself. However, the food is always hot and fresh. The portions are standard size and the pricing is comparable to other Chinese restaurants in the area. Another positive perk we have experienced is that our food is always delivered 10 - 15 minutes ahead of schedule. In regard to take-out the only difference between Szechuan and other restaurants is that we never receive fortune cookies.

On its own, Marathon would rate a 4. But in a sea of great places to eat in the downtown Philly area, its tough to rate it that high.

Good, solid, competent food. I'd eat here again, but to be honest, I only dropped by in the first place because my favs were all booked up. Given the choice, I can think of 2 or 3 other places I'd go to first if they weren't cram packed with reservations.

In the middle of Saturday night frenzy of folks, food and music is a brightly colored ice cream shop. The choices of ice cream flavors was just enough to make a good choice quickly.. pralines and cream for me and blueberry cheesecake for my daughter.  So delicious - big chucks of cheesecake , fresh blueberries..  Staff was nice , swift and friendly.

I didn't have time to take the river cruise on the Steamboat Natchez last time I wad in New Orleans and wasn't going to miss out again, so I headed down Toulouse Street to the dock and bought a ticket for the 11.30am trip. The cruise costs $28.50, and for $11 more you can get lunch, which I did.

About five minutes before boarding an old lady on the top deck started belting out a deafening version of "Pennies from Heaven" on the calliope, which I think was intended to let the passengers know we were about to leave. There must have been a couple of hundred other people taking the tour, so I assumed it had to be reasonably good. 

I was wondering why they allowed 30 minutes for boarding, and found out as I got close to the front of the line. There were a few of crew near the gangway taking the obligatory cheesy tourist photo. Honestly, will I fall for this again? Probably...

They pointed the passengers who'd paid for lunch straight into the dining room, which takes up most of the first deck. They give you a little laminated card that says "Occupied" which you put on your table while you browse the buffet. I was greeted by a very friendly lady called Gina as soon as I entered. She settled me in, got me an iced tea, and replaced my bread pudding dessert as she said the first bit was a little bit burnt. How lovely!

The buffet included beans and rice, sausages, some salads, fried catfish and corn bread. Iced tea and iced water is also included in the price, but if you want anything else from the full bar that runs along one wall of the restaurant, you have to pay extra. The catfish was actually really good, and I liked the corn bread too, but the bread pudding was deserving of seconds. Tasted like the steamed pudding I used to have when I was a kid.

There was a good jazz band called The Steamboat Stompers playing at one end of the room when I entered. They politely stopped when the captain started his commentary. The Natchez is actually the sixth or seventh reincarnation of the original 19th century vessel and is only 40 years old, however the engines came from the tow boat Clairton and date from 1910. It's one of only two steamboats still operating in the US.

Gina took my photograph next to the window above the paddle wheel with the New Orleans skyline reflected in the glass, then I went up to the top deck where they have a gift shop. 

We sailed seven miles up the Mississippi passed the site of the Battle of New Orleans where the Americans defeated the British in 1815, thus ending the War of 1812. I could see the white obelisk of the monument commemorating the battle over the top of the levee.

Bought a drink from the Texas Bar on the upper deck and sipped it at a table by the railing under the canopy. The jazz band had started playing again and a cool breeze was coming down the river. Very pleasant. Finished my drink and relocated to the rear upper deck, which also has a small bar. Ordered a Bacardi and coke and watched the river roll by. I can think if a lot worse ways to spend a couple of hours than drifting down the Mississippi in an old paddle steamer. Good tour, and certainly enhanced by gina's excellent customer service.

Sent from my iPad

I ordered the fish taco entrée and it was very tasty. The tacos were a good size with salsa that was flavorful. The restaurant was very busy so I had to wait a while to order, but the overall wait was acceptable. 

I would recommend eating here if you do not mind large crowds.

I love Milktooth, ok.  I've enjoyed eating here for a couple of years now, and have even stolen some of their ideas for my own kitchen (at home).

The fact of the matter is that the food is friggen SALTY.  The chefs practice almost no restraint in salting the food.  I'm currently eating a parmesan, beet, and jalapeno scone from Milktooth that I brought home with me and my throat hurts from how salty it is.  At the restaurant, my fried polenta was almost completely inedible from the salt contents.  Even my Dutch baby suffered from gratuitous salt fingers.

This isn't the first time we've had an issue with salty food at Milktooth.  But we keep going because it's creative food and we like seeing what the chef churns out.  We just wish that he'd keep the salt in check.

Three strikes and they're out. Sandwiches a big problem. I specifically asked for fried onions on my pickup order of a cheesesteak sandwich the first time - got home and no onions. The second time, a few months later, I ordered an Italian hoagie and it was just not good. I threw it away after a few sickening bites. Just tonight, I ordered a cheesesteak hoagie, described in the online menu as including onions. I picked it up and when I got home discovered no onions and no cheese. I called them to inform them of these omissions. I was told that "you have to ask for onions" (but this was an online order, with no indication that you had to request onions, which were listed as ingredients in the description of the item). Furthermore, when I noted the absence of cheese on the cheesesteak, I was told that "it's mixed in." Yuk. This reminds me of pink slime-it's a premixed meat-cheese concoction. Kind of like BrundleFly (see movie The Fly, with Jeff Goldblum). The concept is disgusting. Stick with WAWA for your junk food urges.  The staff people are nice enough, however. Still, WAWA - even nicer - and their guilty pleasures are much more palatable.

It's our first time in Indianapolis and this place made such an impression. Everything about it is perfection. The food is to die for and the decor and atmosphere are so fun and quant. Don't forget to try one of their specialty drinks!

I'm so happy to have found a wonderful local ice cream shop! Their ice cream is fantastic and very reasonable (under $5 for 2 one scoops in waffle cones).  l love that they are family owned and they support the community. Definitely try Daddy Dawgs!

I really expected a much better eatery here in my hotel. The atmosphere is awesome, very trendy and very modern in it's dining area.

However, the food is mediocre at best and extremely slow service - unacceptable at those inflated prices on the menu.

If I return, I'm just going to sit at the bar, enjoy the view and a cold beverage - that's all.

This is a better than average diner that has excellent breakfast. They are also very fairly priced. I usually get the French toast, which is a huge portion, because the batter they use is amazing. I have also had the pancakes (average) and omelet. I found the omelets to be a little scarce on the cheese, which is a pet peeve of mine. They also deep fry their scrapple, which is a huge win in my book. Not quite as good as the Springfield diner, but never has the long wait, and is somewhat cheaper.

Sandwich is delicious and all home made except bread.  They are so kind. They heard my daughter has a food allergy and they didn't want her to be hungry to go to church. They made another new sandwich for my daughter.  My daughter loves it. Bubble tea is delicious as well. I love everything hot, they made warm Jasmine green tea with bubble for me.  They are amazing. You won't regret it if you go there.  Good luck.

Ok so I'm super hungover from the White Party.  I spot Enerjuicer and thought omgosh I need this right now!!  I walked in and met Micah, what a great asset she is to this business.  I told her my needs and she whipped up an amazing healing smoothie that I'm sipping right now.  Prices are good and omgosh they actually have FRESH fruits and veggies right in their case !!!    

Only one disappointing  issue, there's no tip line on the cc ring. I wanted to take care of Micah for taking care of me.   

Owners,  it's 2016. .. PLEASE update your machine so that our community can take care of your employees!!!!  Otherwise I will hire her away from you. Lol.  Kidding.

Consistently delicious food and great service provided by Giuseppe and his family and expert staff! Just hosted a baby shower here that was over the top awesome! I've hosted several private parties- showers, surprise birthday , wedding rehearsal dinner, wedding reception, and hundreds of family dinners here over the last 20+ years and have never been disappointed. This was our " go to" local restaurant since they opened in Glassboro. We have recently moved from the area but I decided to return to Italian Affair for this important and special shower because I knew that my guests would enjoy a great meal in a beautiful setting. So although IA can't be my "go to" local place any longer... It will still be my " go to " have a great meal/ party/ be treated like family place!

Visited last night for the first time. We will be back very soon!! Had the hot Thai special pho, all I can say is I have had pho and other soups from the best places in town and they don't compare to what I had last night...amazing!!
Sabrina and get son Jarrod are very nice and spent time explaining how everything is prepared to order and ingredients are bought fresh every day. It shows in the quality of the food. They do not Gabe a liquor license but you can bring in wine or other beverages at no charge!
By all measures, EXCELLENT!!

Came here with my boss and some coworkers for a holiday party. It was my first time here and it was amazing! The food was delicious!! Our sever was very nice and quick! The space was a little small for how popular they are but i didn't really mind it.

The decor and atmosphere of the restaurant was really cute and country like. I love the wooden furniture and all. Our waitress was super sweet and checked on us regularly. I ordered the hot chicken sandwich with truffle fries. The sandwich wasn't as hot as I'd hoped, but I also have a pretty high heat tolerance so most food isn't. The sandwich was juicy and flavorful, though, so I'd definitely order it again. I've found a new love for truffle fries recently so I approve of the ones here. A girl friend that I was with never had them before so when she tried it for the first time, she instantly became addicted. I look forward to trying more of their menu.

While visiting Florida my mom treated us to a mani/pedi service at this spa.  When she booked the service on the phone she was never told that any service gets you use of the facility on the property or that there will be an additional 18%tax on top of the nail service BECAUSE of facility use.

The total for 2 mani/pedi's plus tip cost $250.00 (WHAT).  My moms French manicure started to peel off in less than two days.  I also feel if when you check in for a service and decline use of the facility (we had no idea it was an option at this point, not until I was getting my pedi and the technician shared this info with us) you should not be charged a tax to use the facility. 

My mom called and asked for a refund for her nail service. It took 3 different managers and they would not credit her the full price of the manicure.  This spa is great if you like being taxed for a spa and hotel property that is straight out of the 70's and nail technicians that want to talk about their sick moms and medical conditions.

I went to Aroma for the first time today to check out their lunch special and I was very pleasantly surprised. For about $9, you get to choose 2 entrees from a list, rice, and a basket of naan. I had the chicken tikka masala and the chicken curry. The chicken tikka masala was some of the best I've ever had and the chicken curry was just the right amount of spicy. The staff was friendly and attentive. I'm so glad to have aroma in town and I can't wait to try everything else they have!

Over Hyped

Heard a lot about this place and have been planning to try them for a while. I had high hopes. Sadly they were roundly dashed wroth the first course. 

The rotolo, a much publicized item on the menu, was...meh! Muted flavors, hard (but not in that crispy goodness way. Rather it tasted like it'd been sitting out and was reheated.) 

We tried the special meatball pizza. Again, it was ok. The crust was good, but the sauce and toppings were a bit bland.

The staff was friendly, but the server never returned to ask if I wanted another drink.

All on all, for the amount of money there are many other pizza places I n Philly.

Better than most chains but still a chain. I  think the waiters and waitresses are excellent. The decor is dated and too dark for my tastes. Better than Chiles, Friday's, and the other giants. Not a bad place if you are in the area but not a destination place.

This place is crazy good.  The service is amazing and the food is delicious and well presented.  The portions are more than adequate and you get more than you pay for.  There is nothing on the menus I would not have again and again.  If you like Indian food this is the place to eat in Mt Juliet. This is place is flat out delicious!

My kids and I love eating here. I have also held several business meetings here as well. The atmosphere lends itself well to both. Nice contemporary decor, great Thai/Laos/Vietnamese  food, boba is the best in the Tampa Bay Area hands down. The service is impeccable and everything is very clean. Wifi available, I have ordered a snack open my laptop and gotten work done w little to no interruption from staff. There is also an outdoor space.

Among the bet breakfast and brunch locations in Tucson. Food sometimes takes a bit of time to come out but it is WELL worth the wait. Their food is really good and so so clean.

They have a great selection of their in-house baked goods that change occasionally.

The staff is really kind, helpful, and very patient. I've been here numerous times and will continue to come back.

First off- I love their brunch, the atmosphere, and most of the waitstaff is great, especially outside. But the hostess that takes your name on Sundays, as there is usually a wait, is straight up nazi. I get the policy "everyone in party must be present to be seated." But she takes it a step further with everyone must be there just to get your name on the list. We usually have a big group, including toddlers, I'm tempted to let those kids run wild in there until our table is ready. Instead a few in our group sneak off to the playground while waiting, but watch out if your table is ready and a few of you are 2 minutes away! You will be reprimanded by the hostess. 
  Recently had friends go their for lunch on a not busy Tuesday and they left because the first couple arrived early and wanted to get drinks "at the table" while they waited for their friends. Hostess refused to seat them even though there were numerous empty tables. 
  Fix the front of the house Kelly's!
Do not order beignets. It will take forever. Also, make sure someone writes down your order, otherwise it'll be forever lost in the abyss that is this place's organization.

Stopped in after a dance session with friends. Daniel's gorgeous blue eyes had us in a trance. He was such an awesome host. We even checked out his website (he's an artist). We couldn't get enough of him. I can't even remember our waitress' name since we kept calling for him. Anyhoo I guess I should write something about the food.  The steak & eggs were delicious!  My friends had the fried chicken with sweet potato waffles, stuffed french toast, & crabcakes. They also enjoyed their meals. Will definitely be back, & not just to get lost in Daniel's eyes. LOL

Very disappointed with the service my coworkers and i had yesterday from your establishment especially from the manager Linda. My coworker reserved an area for a retirement/birthday and was told there was going to be another party of only 6 ppl apparently they were going to watch the band (by the way not worth it) As i arrived to my group, about a half an hour later, we were told that we needed to clear off our area bc of the other party which the management told her was only going to be 6 ppl and that by the time their party arrived my party was going to be a lesser crowd to at least be settled for one table at the corner. Well that was not the case, so we were rushed by Linda ( which she clearly said let me help here and  clear to get them out) to be put at the tiki tables that was already occupied by a gentlemen and she tells us to get him out of the table....Clearly very POOR service AND Managenent by Linda!!! Our waiter was the only employee that was very nice and was trying to keep us happy (even though too late) so i can't complain about him. 

The appetizers are very overpriced (not out of this world) and my piña colada was watered down and overpriced as well.

My agency has been devout costumers many times in the past reserving for happy hours!  This incident has completely ended our choice to come here anymore.
This place hits the spot on every note. Strong coffee, delicious biscuits, & perfect NOLA atmosphere. Love it.
Great local breakfast/brunch eatery. Their menu is always fresh with new entrees and the staff is always accommodating

Just let me say being from MD and going to FL for crabs was the biggest mistake of my trip!  I believe the name of this place should be changed unless every where you go in FL they try to take away the taste of the crab with hunks of garlic and butter.  PLEASE FOR FUTURE REFERENCE CRAB AND OLD BAY IS ALL I SHOULD TASTE ON MY CRAB.

Came here for lunch on a Monday and was immediately impressed with both the decor and the menu. Half price burgers on Mondays? Don't mind if I do! Oh, dollar off drinks? Why thank you! The Kennet square burger was awesome and you can choose from fries, salad or fried rice for a side. I got fries, which came with what I think was wasabi spiced ketchup. My lunch partner got a burger with a side of fried rice, which was probably the best fried rice I've tasted in a while. All in all this place has a great vibe, a nice draft list and delicious food. The service is excellent and our bill was a whopping $16 dollars for two burgers and a Namaste on draft. I can't wait to come back for the 1.25 oyster and half price wine bottle Thursdays.

This has been one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans so far. We ordered the dirty rice and tuna tartare to start, and then the curry goat and seafood pasta as an entree. The service was personalized and exquisite. Don't leave without the banana zeppole for dessert either. Would highly recommend for someone looking for a rich food experience!!

GOD BLESS THIS LITTLE GIRL NAMED COURTNEY!    Everyone that eats here should not only ask for her but let others know how amazing this little server is.   My wife had a test done at the hospital across the street and after that we decided to grab breakfast at metro.   We already love metro and never have had a issue with the Food ,service or pricing.   

Courtney was our server and this little girl was slammed with at least 7-9 tables that we could count and witness.  She was drowning and no one seemed to want to help her out.   Food was correct and wonderful and usual.   I've then seen other customers getting rude and complaining about every little thing.  Even that the ac was too cold.   ( you sat yourself ) did your dumb ass see the ac vent right above your head?   Geeeze.   Anyways it seemed Courtney was about ready to cry.  Not because she was fed up, because I could see that she has real passion for her job and strives to do the best and offer great customer service and due to the over booking her on multiple tables she could not do so.   Still love metro, still will continue to eat there,  but being directors of a major company along with my wife being a director of a major company. The managers need to do more than stand around and watch.  Be active in your staff and assist when needed.  This little girl you don't wanna lose because someone will hire her and give her the tools to be a superstar!!!    From the couple that tipped you 100% of the cost of the bill. You deserved it :). Hang in there

I've been here twice to this established Metairie institution. 

The first time was for a luncheon and we had a set menu to choose from. I chose their redfish in a lemon sauce with a side of roasted potatoes. Fish was perfectly cooked and very flavorful. Same with the potatoes and the haricot verts that accompanied everything. Bread pudding was served. Slightly dry but still pretty good. 

So I was excited to hear about their anniversary on the local morning show. To celebrate their 30 year anniversary, in January, they had a limited menu of stuff they served when they first opened. It 
was also going to be their prices during that time too! 

Needless to say, I was very excited to check this place again. Since my mom's birthday is in January, I decided to take her to lunch there for her birthday dinner. Once we got there, I realized it was a good decision. 

Most of the patrons were my mom's age (read 60+). Not sure if that was because of the anniversary or if it was because they were their normal clients. Either way, I was hoping the stuff wouldn't be overcooked or bland. 

It ended up being much worse. We got the shrimp linguine and the mushroom ravioli. Both of us decided to get a couple of salads. My mom's Caesar was drenched in dressing on the 4 romaine leaves that consisted of. My Caprese was very old mozzarella and a very garlicky vinaigrette which was more garlic and oil than anything else. Major disappointment.

The entrees were actually not much better. The linguine had a horrible alfredo sauce while my ravioli was 5 raviolis. Sauce was much better than my mom. But I was still very hungry after the server took away my plate. 

Overall, could not believe the portions, prices and quality of what was served. For an Italian restaurant, I was hoping they would be have great alfredo sauce. Unfortunately, Andrea's proves that's not the case.

What happened to you, Mac and cheese? I've been coming here for years and this year it has changed. Just not as good as it used to be. Love the thyme after thyme, it will always by my favorite drink in the city but your food has gone downhill the past few years.
Milktooth is very hit or miss.  Sometimes, the food is fantastic.  Other days it is very average.  The service is always great.
This place is truly a hidden gem offering great Italian meals and sandwiches at a reasonable price. A must try to see for yourself spot.

Great beer. The tour is a must. I e been on a lot of brewery tours but this one was the most informative one. The tour and tasting lasted about an hour and 45 minutes. You get three predetermined samples at the end of the tour.

Took a client/friend to lunch the other day and had the beef pho soup out of this world but what made it better was having the left overs for dinner. We have had the cauliflower burger there before and that was a 10. Will make it a point to frequent there more often
Horrible service waited a good while and no server came or acknowledged us. A couple seated after us was taken care of so after waiting another 5 min left. They didn't even notice.

Thought we would give this location another try after our last very disappointing experience.  How do you give a restaurant a bad review on take out? Went to pick up my order and waited 8 minutes at the take out booth just to be acknowledged (there wasn't a lounge either).  I did see what looked like two managers walk by me with no acknowledgement from either.  They also appear to have atleast three  hostesses standing around chit chatting with each other.  Why don't they have one of the extra hostesses assist take out? Either way I see their customer service hasn't improved.  The food may be decent,but eventually poor management and customer service will doom this place.  Once again management doesn't  seem to care. Our first experience the waitress offered to microwave our cold food,and even then the manager didn't seem to concerned.

I stopped by Essene last night in an effort to get some basics without making a trip to a bigger grocery store.  On the whole, I liked it-- I love that you can buy their produce in smaller quantities than most other places (and I think their loose spring mix is a great deal-- usually when I buy spring mix in those huge bags they sell at Superfresh, it goes bad fast and I end up trashing half of it).  The hot food bar was good, but pretty pricey.  All in all, I think they have some good deals, but you have to be discriminating about what you get.  Desert Pepper salsa, 2 for $6: YES!  A tiny tub of soy ice cream for $6: not so much.

Note: for any carnivores, there is NO MEAT in the store.  I was figuring that they'd have grass fed/free range-type fare, but it's a good thing to know before you plan on doing your shopping there.

I would give this place 0 stars if I could. The owner is incredibly rude and RACIST! Went in here on a Friday night. All of my friends and I are well over 18, yet the owner kept yelling at us (I mean literally screaming), trying to say that we were showing him fakes. Finally he sat us and got annoyed after my friend questioned if there was a menu we could look at, saying that we asked too many questions and if didn't like that there wasn't a menu we could leave. Well we gladly did, with this man following closely behind us and aggressively shoving my black male friend out the door. Please do NOT patronize this business.

Very atmospheric inside, warm and lively.  Cute covered front porch as well. I had a great chicken salad sandwich on a gilled brioche bun with a Caesar salad for lunch. It was great. Service friendly and prompt. A tad pricey, but not bad. I'll come back.  Great spot to jump off the Schuylkill for drinks and eats.

Don't trust the map. They have three locations. One is at Trolley Sq. We found the one on Kirkland Hwy, about 8 miles away from the mapped location.
