Real Neapolitan cooking. I had a puttanesca sauce on fettuccine, and my spouse had angel hair with garlic and olive oil.

We had no room for their tiramisu.

We love this place! The entire staff is super friendly and welcoming. The pizzas are so creative, and there is no such thing as a bad pizza here. We just tried the special, the loaded baked potato pizza, and holy crap. Party in my mouth. We also love the draft root beer. Brixx is a great place to spend a Saturday afternoon in Fishers! Highly recommend.
Excellent service and staff. Food is great always and fast.i would highly recommend it to anyone trying to have a good time or a casual night out.

I love this menu. 

Thank goodness there's still some New Orleans restaurants that aren't afraid to make pomme frites.
I like the interior... but, the food is overpriced and the owner is very chatty.  Usually, I come in for lunch and need to eat fast and get back to work.
We visited the restaurant for a wedding reception and the food and service was great.  The terrace had great seating that overlooks the gorgeous City Park and convenient free valet parking.

Jimmy's is great for a good drink, great ambience and just being able to relax. It's not insane busy like most places on the island.
Stacy was a great server! Definitely would come back and ask to sit in her section.
Where the pho you been all my life!  Great food, great ambiance, great staff. Will be back soon!

Had some problems at this place.  The food was ok and a nice selection of beer.  Lots of tvs for games and a nice waitress.  Sounds good so far but our problem here was the noise ... ok so I'm sounding old here but NO one at any of the tables around us could carry a conversation __ and we were sitting outside. That's the first problem.   Second, the noise was from a basketball game even though the Lightning game was on ( the small TV by the bar) anyone watching sports was watching that game not the bb game.  Third and worst part was we complained to the manager who refused to turn it down saying that every one wanted to see and hear that game and continued to argue with us ( not mean - but un necessarily) while we ate. Ok. So there is my vent.  we will not go back .....  Oh and btw the tables around us all agreed ( after the mgr left).  SO if you are under I'd say 27 you will be ok here, if you are older, find another place.

Let me start by saying that I only gave it 4 stars at this time, because it is the first and only time I have eaten here, BUT that will change. :) 

We were at this restaurant for a bridal shower. First time we have been here or for that matter the first time we ever heard of the place. 

The service was very good... the serving sizes were something like you have never seen before.... I know that Jillian from The Biggest Loser, would never approve... but what the heck!!! You can get 2-3 meals for the price of one. 

I have read comments about lack of flavor, BUT I don't have anything but the best to say about the flavor of my dish. I had the Manicotti and it had some of the greatest tasting marinara sauce I have tasted lately. 

We are definitely going back... we have finally found another place to partake.... Only negative about this place is that I have to drive about an hour to get to it.... however, it will be well worth the drive....

I like famous Dave's ribs - which comes with 2 sides.  I am only giving two stars because they are really cheap with their sides.  Sides that come with dinner are small portions and if you want a baked potato or green salad- my two favs- you have to pay $2.00 extra- 
Not good!  
I had brisket this time  - which was dry, even with sauce (wouldn't order again).

Two years later and I still love this place!  The staff is still awesome!!  I love that this establishment puts an emphasis on their staff, it is very much appreciated.  They've add a LOT to their menu in the past few years and it's all really good.  Love the pesto chicken wrap and the Hummus Board!  To this day, I have not be disappointed, EVER!

The food at this Chili's is pretty much the same you'll find at any Chili's - I find it OK, though I did find the chicken enchilada soup to be very good.

While accidents do happen, it was a bit unpleasant to bite into a turkey sandwich and end up biting into a hidden lime.  They also incorrectly charged me for my soup.

I liked Horn's. I really just didn't think it was that bad! However, it wasn't outstanding, and I'm not dying to go back. 

I had the chicken plate (not sure what exactly it's called) which DELICIOUS zucchini side dishes. That was divine! The ladies that work here are nice. It's the kind of place you come to waste some time and have long, sprawling conversations. I wouldn't come here if you're trying to get in and out. The mac n cheese is so good. I ate all of my side :)

I haven't tried brunch yet, but I think I will sometime soon.

This upscale casual bar is a favorite in town and I'm jazzed to give it the first review. Drinks are moderately priced and the decor and atmosphere are tops. Music & dancing too. Not a loud nightclub vibe, it's classy and stylish.

Absolutely great restaurant. The people the ambience the food all great. For sure a 5 star for value, service and ambience. The only reason I gave it a 4 star was the bread. Maybe a bit harsh to do but a 5 star restaurant had to has the basics at a 5 star level- bread and coffee. Didn't have coffee but had the bread. Martini was fabulous- halibut was wonderful and the butter lettuce salad was delicious. Will come back and highly recommend.

Wonderful home cooked Southern Italian food in a comfortable friendly setting with excellent service. We took my mom there for her 84th and it became a very special day indeed. Thank you La Vecchia Osteria.
Best place for breakfast!!! Everything is made from scratch and the SOS is to die for! Even though we moved to philly we still make the trip almost every Saturday for breakfast!!

The bagels are delicious and fresh! Tons of flavors to choose from:)
Anytime I offer to get breakfast for anyone I always go here.
They also have breads, drinks, and a case full of flavored cream cheese.

My only complaint is that the parking lot is small and people use it that are not patrons :(

So every time I go here now I get the chicken comfort bowl and a whoolybugger. I'm usually going to try different foods but this place I can't maked myself try something because I just love the comfort bowl so much!

Pleasant relaxed atmosphere, with very friendly service. Food portions are very generous and exceptionally fresh. Will come back. Small staff, and wait times may be a while if they're very busy, but it will be well worth the wait.

This place was extremely disappointing!
First, they pointed us to a dirty table,and they didn't give us napkins or silverware! When they brought out the coffee they didn't bring anything to go with it, or ask us if we wanted anything with it like sugar, or milk!
We even had to ask for silverware and napkins! For the food every one of us had something missing that they said came with the meal! We had to ask them repeatedly to bring the items that we ordered! This is not a repeater!

We were at the Davis island dog park when the rain came in. We were starving and I found this place on yelp. I called because they had noted a dog friendly patio, which they did. We walk up and the pups were offered water and treats before us, super cool!!! They brought a bowl out and some milk bones for my friends and my dog. Great draft beer selection with good prices! Food was amazing, I had the BLT with a fried egg and it was mouth watering. Not only that it was quick, granite the place was slow but still.  The lovely waitress kept checking on us to make sure were ok, we were there about 4 hours just kicking it on the patio. Hands down an awesome place for you and your pooch. This will be my go to place after we go to the dog park from now on.

In the past this has been a great place. However, the service this time was dreadful and the food not the same quality. Others in my party had the Paradise Burger and were satisfied with their meal. I on the other hand had the cioppino, it was by far the worst I have had anywhere. There was no broth and it seemed they reheated it in the microwave. The center was too hot to eat and the rest was luke warm at best.

This would have all been fine if not for the lack of service. Even after we let them know  one of our party was diabetic and needed to eat it still took an hour to get our food.

Their house bloody marys weren't as good as expected, the ones at the cup on Congress are better. took half hour for the food and 45 minutes for the check. And it was a Thursday morning. Most of the food was bland. My friend got the duck, and I got the dish with eggs and chile. Maybe I have to try something else to understand why this place is all the rage. It's more for older people.
This place is excellent.   My cousin brought us here while we were visiting from Miami.  OMG great food.  We got a bunch of items and shared everything.

Excellent service and food was delicious! We went on a Sunday during the holidays and brought our own wine. We even bought a Limoncello wine glass to add to our collection. 
We plan to go back very soon. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

I went in to try the new shop, and I was blown away by the food. The pita was soft and had the right texture, and the garlic sauce and chicken were seasoned perfectly. You definitely need to try this new business. The employees were very patient and kind to me.

Oh my gosh. The Tennessee fudge ice cream is gonna make you die of happiness. The scoops are huge! They also have chocolate chip cookie cones!! I didn't get it cuz I just had a large dinner but I would have! Next time! The decor of the place was cute too :)

Best pizza in Tampa by far. Authentic and delicious. Inside is comfortable and inviting. Had a small problem with the chicken parm and it was immediately taken away and replaced by some of the best pizza I have had.   Staff was courteous and attentive. Dinner was a bit pricey but worth it. You won't be disappointed.
Chicken fingers were good. The sauce was great. Had the right mixture of spiceyness and flavor. Didnt see anything else but chicken fingers on menu.

I had my food delivered to me, so I can't comment about the ambience or the atmosphere. However, the person who took my order over the phone was extraordinarily friendly and nice, and the food was absolutely terrific. I got the vegetable samosas, Chana masala, and some naan. Everything was well made and tasted wonderful. I highly recommend this place.

We were at a winery and decided to get ice cream.  They had a new dessert with a Belgian Waffle:  One we got had pumpkin ice cream and pumpkin butter.  The other had vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce.  OMG!  To die for.  The crispy fresh waffle threw the ice cream over the top.  All four of us loved it.  It takes a while to cook but worth the wait.  The owner is also very nice and listens.

Our service was great, and the food was good, but 2 workers were arguing very loud and we could hear it at our table.  It was  disturbing to try to have a nice family lunch while this was going on.  Not sure where the manager was, because nobody broke it up.

I just placed a large catering order with this location this past weekend. You can place all the catering orders online and I even called the location to change my order and they where very helpful. Very pleased with how the food was ready to go on time when I came to pick it up. This location parking lot is very small and can become crowded quickly if the drive-thru line is full. Food and service are always quality!

I have been here twice for Brunch both times and have not been disappointed yet. I had the Chef's omelette the first time and a great bloody Mary. The next time I had the duck confetti it was really good different but good.  We always leave with a pastry and they are amazing. Love Love Love this place I think I am heading there for lunch tomorrow.

Had an ok meal. Went once, but the atmosphere was so crowded. Tables so close together and a lot of conversation made the room loud. The food was ok, it was just really loud that we couldn't hear our own conversation.

I thought this place was good.  I met up with a group of friends for the Happy Hour.  I made an online reservation, but had requested additional seating if it was possible.  The day of our reservation, I received a phone call alerting me that they would not be able to put us all together, but could reserve two booths back to back.  This was fine with me.  It did become a little awkward for our group at times, trying to turn around to talk, but that was more my own fault for not calling ahead, too.  They were really accommodating and even allowed us to order off the Happy Hour menu even though we were not in the Saloon or on the Patio (as stated on their Happy Hour menu).  The service was prompt and continual.  Our waiter was really helpful and upbeat, always nice!  I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip and it was great!  My fiance ordered the chicken tenders and the sausage flat bread.  He said they were good, too.  Our drinks were constantly refilled, and the tables were cleared as we ordered more appetizers.  All in all, I found this to be a great meeting place for our group.  Parking was easy, too.  I'll definitely go back!

I had dinner at Herbies two weeks ago.  The food was great, but the service was less than lackluster.  Our waiter went missing several times and always came back smelling of smoke.  My group of six had several courses and the previous plates were rarely cleared before the next course came.  At one point there were so many plates on the table that I had to take my newly arrived course and transfer it to my butter plate, because there was simply no room on the table for another dish. Even that didn't seem to be a clue to the server to clear the plates.

At this price point, I just am not willing to tolerate that level of sloppiness. While I enjoyed my food, I expected a better overall experience.  I doubt I'll be back.
Great donuts for sure! The fried chicken is tender and crispy outside. Pretty amazing. The only thing is the chicken is always salty, too salty. Otherwise this would def be a five star riew.

We are visiting New Orleans for a conference and Jazz Fest. I have very fond memories of meals here at Mr. B's so I knew we had to eat at Mr. B's at least once during out visit.  I'm always happy to share a meal here because everything I order here is always delicious and so enjoyable. It was the first time for my husband but I've got him hooked. 

We ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp with red-eye gravy and grits.  Mike loves grits done the 
the old fashion southern way like how his great Aunt made it.  The grits here were rich smooth creamy and satisfying.  But the shrimps with bacon with the red eye sauce is what shined.  I practically licked the plate.  We also ordered gumbo ya ya and crab cake on a bed of Maque Choux.  I could'nt finish everything but the maque choux was so delicious I had to scoop up the remainder to go so I could enjoy later.

For dessert we enjoyed the mixed berry cobbler. It was a very memorable meal.

I was here with my sister and her family 3 years ago for Thanksgiving and although we all did not order the traditional Thanksgiving meal, we all shared the different dishes and were completely happy with what we had.


This is an update I need to mention:

Upon arriving home and and later checking our credit card statement for which we used to pay our tab, we found that the waiter that served us took it upon himself to add a couple of bucks plus to his tip on our credit card after we had already signed our credit card slip.  We were more than appropriate with his tip. Maybe most people don't compare their signed slips with their CC statements and they can get away with this. I know it's just a couple of dollars but this practice is soooo unethical. 

I have been to Mr.B's a handful of times when visiting and have been happy with the food and service but this has really tarnished it for me.  I can't ever return here.

Delicious!

I found this place because I thought I wanted pizza for dinner, but once I looked at the menu, I couldn't resist the macaroni and cheese, made memorable by the addition of pasilla chiles. My husband enjoyed his dishes also, as well as his flight of wine.

The menu is particularly generous with vegetarians: there are soup, salad, sandwich, burger, pizza, and entree options. Vegetarians will be especially happy with the explicitly vegetarian French onion soup; this is a treat we rarely get in restaurants.

The atmosphere is lovely also; quiet and refined. All in all, a great restaurant.

Tried to get here the weekend it opened but the lines were very long. Second weekend, no lines.  Brought my daughter to grab a chili dog and fries. She liked the chili dog, I did not, but for $3 you can't expect much. Maybe avoid the chili.  Maybe avoid the cheese as well. The cheese was something resembling cheese whiz but more gelatinous and transparent.  The fries while abundant were soggy and tasteless. The gelatin based "cheese" did not help the fries.  I did like the lemonade though so there is that.  If you are in a hurry, best to stay away as the 2 chili dogs, fries and 2 drinks had me waiting 15 minutes with no lines. Cost for all this happiness was $13. Again,  you can't expect too much at that price. I will come back and try the ice cream as that portion of the menu seemed to be more popular than the food.

I was a bit harsh giving it one star based on horrible service experience.

The pizza was good.

Just make sure you do not get your drinks yourself!
The food wasn't terrible, but the service was poor and the decor was bland. The facilities aren't very clean.
Food was delicious and I'm stuffed. Chicken chimichanga was moist and so flavorful. Our waiter Brandon was awesome. So friendly and helpful with the huge menu. Cheers

Had a bad experience- our waitress was wearing her long hair down and when she was serving our drinks the ends of her hair were falling in our ice teas and food plates. The mash potatoes were fake tasting and my corn bread was cold and dry. There were flies all around the salad bar. We spent $20 for two people during lunch. Poor quality food and poor service.Never will go back.

Awesome little breakfast spot if you're in the mood for good coffee and donuts! They have eclectic flavors like matcha, maple siracha, and whiskey ginger. They change up their flavors a lot too. The iced chai tea is really good--not too sweet when you order with almond milk. My only complaint was that as a vegetarian, besides the donuts, there weren't any biscuit or egg options without meat. However they are super accommodating and easily substituted avocado for the bacon on my miso praline egg biscuit. Also huge plus is that they have their own side lot for parking!

Very dissapointed this time around. Ordered exactly the same thing i ordered last time. Was charged more for a drink when i ordered a shot on the rocks as i did the last 5 times i was there, ordered a "ribeye" and was given a non ribeye and also charged more than last time. That was the 2nd time only in 10 years that i did not leave a tip. She said (mandy i believe?) to blame the owner. Tried to argue with me about the drink, which i said i wouldnt argue with her over. But i could only drink half the drink because i have to drive...which is why i wanted a single shot instead of a double and as a drink. I was charged $7 more than last time when i ordered the last time & got the wrong cut of meat. Unacceptable! The first time in years that i left a restaurant in a bad mood!

I'm not exactly sure how this place is getting such good reviews. Besides the fact that the staff was kind...I ordered guacamole and chips, a chicken taco, and a beef taco. The guacamole was old and bland...it literally tasted like nothing, the chips super oily and tasteless, the tacos were cold. The chicken had a odd taste...possibly nutmeg? Not sure but it wasn't for me. I prefer more spice/heat for my tacos. The beef was also cold and didn't have a good taste. I could of done better with an Old Elpaso taco kit from the grocery store. I'm sad that I wasn't pleased. But maybe it was just me because at least 4 "soccer mom types" were waiting in line for pickup??

Update* The owner Ben has reached out to me and offered an apology and a refund. That means a lot. Thanks Ben and good luck to you with the continued success of your eatery.

Staff friendly, plenty of seating. Nice view of the water when sitting outside, which is where we sat. Inexpensive and quick service. No line. Nothing over the top, average diner breakfast.

I ordered a basic breakfast, buttermilk pancakes and sausage links.

Restaurant had paper straws, kinda tasted funny with whatever you drink. Only thing I didn't like. 

Birds around but just mostly on the ground, not borthering anybody.

This is my third visit to Maynards. This is my first review of it.  My first visit was good. My second visit was fair. This last time was terrible.

We arrived on time for our reservation but had to wait 20 minutes to be seated.  Service was very slow and lousy.  Martini was a half filled glass.  Bread came after our salads.   The Porkchop  was fatty and small.  My daughter had the duck -  it was bloody rare and had to be sent back.  Management did not even follow up on the problem.  

Overall a terrible experience.  I am done with this place.

Opening Day and already in love!! Definitely a new go-to place to eat whenever I'm casually hungry. When I walked into the store, I was already in adoration by how cute and neatly decorated the whole place looks. 
The service is great: Esther and Shelly were super helpful and patient. The whole staff is really friendly and takes the time to greet and say hello to individual tables and customers. The food came out a lot faster than I thought even when there was quite a long line. The Korean food is delicious, definitely recommend the spicy-pork bibim-bap but the tofu and dak-galbi tastes good as well! Everything tastes so authentic. The japchae is more rich in flavor and not so dry like other places. The spicy mayo and teriyaki sauce really compliment the food and they provide cute little sporks to eat it with. For sure coming here again!!

This place is a GreAt time! I had never ate there before and so glad i did 

Appetizer- basket of onion rings with southwest ranch dipping sauce.  They were cooked perfectly the sauce was amazing! 

I had 15 wings for dinner mix of garlic parm,  asian zing, and mango habanero . The latter were my favorite!! So flavorful and amazing 

Meghan is a great server took good care of us ! Ask for her she is good

I will be back!

We had a great experience today at Burger Up! Our server David was awesome. He realized immediately that we were kind of in a hurry, so he took our order quickly. He was super friendly and made sure the girls and I were well taken care of!! 
This is why Burger Up is one of our favorite restaurants!

THE best breakfast in Clearwater! Charming, funky cafe with tons of great service and homemade everything. Bakery onsite. Get there early if u want to eat outside. Lots of seating inside. We loved it so much we went 2x during our short 5 day stay in the area.

Very nice place to eat! If you leave this place hungry, it's your own fault! The portion sizes are huge!  

Just Good Food! If your in NOLO, PUT THIS PLACE ON YOUR TO DO LIST!
Stopped in tonight and had the White Pizza with garlic and chicken and the Meatball Parm sandwich. Pizza was excellent and the Meatball Parm is the best we've had in the area. Highly recommended!
Pint room is awesome..Nice atmosphere..Hangover burger ohhh really good! Try the lady killer cocktail!!! Wil b back for moreeee!

I've been enjoying this pizza place since it opened but based on my recent experiences, the quality and taste has dramatically declined. Truly disappointed and being that it is so expensive, it's definitely not worth the price.

This place is awesome! Food is delicious and tastes really fresh. I order to-go here regularly and dined in recently, the quality is always great and I've yet to be disappointed. My favorite is the Gyros Plate. Just writing this review makes me hungry! And don't forget to check out the store while you're there... lots of select foods, fresh veggies and hookah supplies.

We went on a rare New Orleans chilly, rainy Sunday night and warmed up with craft libations and a charismatic local live French jazz performance. The size of the venue makes you feel at home all while enjoying top notch tunes
Great neighborhood martini bar with one of the best interiors on S. Grand!  Sam makes great cocktails and the owners are awesome.  Try the St. Germain Cocktail and the "Simply The Best" Margarita!

Can't believe I'm just now finding out about this place after living in the area for almost 4 years now. I love their who set up and food is amazing. A menu like no other with specials that change daily. New favorite spot for breakfast or brunch.
Really enjoyed our visit here last weekend. The veggie burger sandwich and fries were just scrumptious!! And the hubs loved the beer flights! Awesome restaurant in a great location!

This place is so cute!

I was always meaning to try this place out , but never really had the time to or thought of coming.

But i'm glad I did. It's very college people orientated, and almost like the stereotypical movie date vibe .

Prices are not bad at all and they have quite the selection for both drinks and food.

But I will say the Matcha Tea I ordered was not the best Matcha, to be honest it was watered down and didnt have much taste to it or even a good amount of sweetness.

But I mean... it was still refreshing. Other than that, i would recommend this place for anybody who needs a good study session or needs a place to get together!
Best oysters hands down!!! Got a dozen of  P&J oysters and inhaled them in 10 sec flat! Bisque is amazeballs too!!
My favorite place! Excellent taste, excellent ingredients, friendly people. thank you!

Went here for a dinner with friends, so yummy!  Great selection of BBQ and the staff was courteous and friendly. It appears to be more of a take out place as there is not a lot of seating, but it was not crowded when we went, so it was not an issue.

The portions are perfect, and I felt everything was reasonably priced.  Will definitely head back when I crave BBQ!

Had dinner here on a Monday evening while I was in town on a business trip.

Service was fast and attentive. I had their $19.99 sushi special, which includes 10 pieces of Nigiri and a tuna roll. I asked the chef if he would change out the tuna roll for a spicy tuna roll, and he went one better and recommended the crunchy spicy tuna roll. Very good call; the roll was delicious.

The special included salad (just lettuce with dressing) and miso soup. Salad wasn't anything special but the miso was hot and tasty.

The rest of the special was good. Fish was fresh and quantities were good. My only comment is that it would have been nice if the chef or waitress had shown me exactly which types of fish were served, as it's pretty much chef's choice. I do know that it included two tuna, a yellow tail, a Krab (I don't think it was authentic but it might have been), an octopus, a salmon, and what I think was mackerel (it was a pretty pungent, oily fish). 

I enjoyed my meal here and would definitely recommend it to others. At $20 the sushi special is a pretty good value, quality and quantity was just right, and service was excellent.

It's a Cosi. There are lots of them in the area so you may think to yourself "I know what I'm getting into" you're wrong!! This place is terrible!! Worse Cosi I've ever been to. They manage to somehow always have the worse tasting food AND their employees are the unfriendliest bunch of people I've ever encountered! And just in case you needed more reasons to stay away it's always dirty with the most confusing food ordering system imaginable. It's not even a system, just chaos.

Pros: Great GF options, awesome server, friendly service, affordable prices, short wait on a busy weekend night. 

Cons: food was just mediocre.

Ate here with my mom on our trip to New Orleans. Overall a decent spot but the food was kinda bland. The customer service was definitely on point. They got us seated and our drinks in no time. Our waitress was on point which is why I granted the restaurant 3stars the food definitely could have been better. We had green tomatoes along with fried fish dinners and oysters.

If you ever want basic chili with gobs of cheese, a touch of crunchy onions, and a side of white bread with American grilled cheese, come to Dot's. All this and 5 packets of saltines can be yours for $5. I quite enjoyed scarfing this down after I got my brake tag across the street at Keith's. This location seems less crowded at lunch than the one closer to Ochsner. Fast, easy and greezy!

LOVE!  Lilly's is my go-to lunch spot.  I get the Penelope Pitstop every time because it is just that good.  A grilled chicken caesar salad with goat cheese and bacon
folded into a flour tortilla - game over.  Devoted fan for life.  Add a bag of Dirty chips and a Boylan's and I am one happy girl.  I only wish I worked closer to Doylestown because I would be there every day.
Driving from Maryland to Philadelphia for a birthday dinner at The Twisted Tail. I have to say the food was phenomenal. Please when you come ask for the server Shawn he is absolutely wonderful.

I've been wanting to try this place for years. Whenever I'm in NO, I hasn't worked out. Today, we went for lunch. It was pretty awesome. 

Those who eat with me know I like to share. From the Express Menu (don't let the name fool you; we were there for at least an hour for lunch),  today's Special is lamb, sausage, olives and panisse. Served like a cassoulet, the lamb was incredibly tender. The olives were not brined and had an interesting texture. The panisse was like a cheesy polenta. I didn't try the sausage, as I had ordered the Assiette de Charcuterie and was in organ meat overload. It was served with an amazing shrimp and oyster gumbo.

Served with toasted bread, there was an amazing pate, head cheese (not really cheese), mortadella, fish dip and a few other terrines served with amazing relishes and chutneys, marmalades and pickles. 

Service was very friendly but a little slow. I expected that my platter would be explained to me, as there were a lot of unique items. 

For about $30 for 2 for an amazing meal, I think it's a great deal. I'm planning to return for the famous Shrimp and Grits.

Had the wings and curly fries. Very good wings, added hot sauce because they lacked kick, but very well cooked, nice crunch.  Other items on the menu look good as well, waitress/bartender very nice and accommodating.

Only negative for my taste regards atmosphere - way too brightly lit, not really a place I would want to just go hang out and have a few beers.

I am a big fan of Fortel's.  Their pizza is consistently good, thin crust pizza, with fresh toppings.  My favorite is the roasted red pepper.  

I took my family there tonight for an early Valentine's Day dinner to enjoy their heart shaped pizzas.  It has been a tradition that we started three years ago.

We ordered a pepperoni pizza with their spicy hot wings and toasted ravioli.  Everything was served hot and fresh. The wings were a bit over sauced and messy, but delicious none the less.

The only reason we didn't give this visit 5 stars is because no one came out to clear any of the tables.  By the time we left there were only two tables in the main room that didn't have a mess on them.  If I had walked in for the first time there, I would've been really concerned and probably not stayed.  Other than the table cleanup issue, everything was excellent.

One of the best dining experiences I've ever had!

Went with my family for a fun night out. Started with the sangria, which was a risk for me, as I'm pretty picky about sangrias. It was light and refreshing, not too sweet, just the right amount of fruit.

We shared the brussel sprouts, the lamb meatball, and the crostini, all of which were amazing. I had the filet with the black truffle butter on top, and it was hands down the best steak I've ever had.

Friendly and fast service, fun and classy atmosphere, food worth every penny. (It is a bit pricey for a regular meal, but definitely go for a special occasion or to snack & drink in the bar area.)

Will definitely be back here! Recommended to anyone.

My husband and I moved across country this past November and stopped in NOLA for a few days to sight see. This restaurant is a MUST while in town. Our first night in town, we were coming in around 7 pm and wanted a place that was close and delicious to eat. I read really great reviews about Muriel ' s on here so we decided to check it out. We both  started with an order of cocktails, mine was the ever so delicious Honeychild, and then ordered  from the prix fix menu for dinner menu. I had the Shrimp and goat cheese crepe, Bayoubaisse, and Pain Perdu Bread Pudding. My husband ordered the Savory Gorgonzola Cheesecake, the Double Cut Pork Chops, and the Pain Perdu Bread Pudding as well for dinner. The food was AMAZING! The shrimp and goat cheese filling was creamy with a perfectly delicate crepe and the Seafood in the Bayoubaisse was so fresh! My husband said his pork chops was the best one he ever had! I tasted it and holy smoky goodness! The Pain Perdu Bread Pudding was probably one of the best bread pudding I've ever had. The ambience of the restaurant and the staff here were just as wonderful! We went to another restaurant the second night in town and both agreed that we should've just came back here!

Got the salmon BLT - tasty! Sweet potato fries were ok but a bit salty and thin for my preferences. Mixed drink - Amaretto sour - was fair/good but it is definitely primarily a bar because the server kept asking my group if they wanted more drinks. I was there for an evening work meeting and needed to drive so one drink was plenty for me!

This is our favorite quick bite. My wife and I love their guacamole and chicken tacos! Great place, great service! 
Eat Local.
If you only have a sec grab a smoothie and roll.

Dude, if you have something bad to say about this place, your an ass. Doughnuts are like the best cake you've ever eaten. Chicken sandwich and ranch powdered fried chicken are freakin awesome. I cant go back cause I'll turn into a fat bastard.
It's not cheep, but worth it.

Delicious food at this Italian Cafe. They have Grinders ($9.00)and pasta meals ($13.00).  Salad was awesome!! Fresh bread with olive oil for dipping. So friendly! Don't forget to have a cannoli for dessert!
I am on a quest to find the best croissant in Philadelphia and so far J'aime's croissant is the best I had. All their patisseries are also excellent, my favorite being the "Paris-Philadelphia"

BJ's never seems to disappoint.  If you don't mind the wait times (and your tab) you will find the food is above average and their selection of Beer is awesome!!!  Service has always been very good as well!!!

Downright awesome! We went early in the morning for a Saturday brunch and luckily didn't have to wait. Even if we did, it would've been worth it! We had crab cakes benedict and the breakfast bowl. The crab cakes were very fresh and clearly made from real crab, covered with a perfectly poached egg and creamy hollandaise sauce. Complete with creamy, oh so creamy grits! The breakfast bowl was colorful an flavorful, although could've used a touch of salt. Friendly service, decent prices for the food and location, and worth coming back!

Excellent food with a relaxed, upscale atmosphere. Pear and Gorgonzola Flatbread pizza rocked as did the Lotus bowl. Nice wine list, and great service. The chocolate cake and ice cream were delicious and we couldn't resist the Apple Crumble!! Worth the cost for sure; looking forward to returning soon.
Pork platter, mac'n'cheese and grits casserole was PERFECT! First meal in Nashville hit the spot.

A nice spot right on bourbon street. Excellent oysters, both raw and broiled. A fabulous Sazarec made by bartender Kitty. 
Go here!!!

The food is decent, the price is high. A 10inch gluten free pizza with one topping is $18. I had the fried chicken. It was good not great but for 20 something dollars I could've gone anywhere for that. The rest of the menu items are OK but over priced as well in my opinion. But I can say I've tried it now. I don't know that we will be back.
Love this place!! Foods great!! burgers and wings are so big and taste are amazing!! If you're looking for a good burger spot this is definitely the place for you

This place is great! We started with the lava tempura which was amazing! Then I had the pad thai and he pad kee mao, both delicious. We also had a Thai tea that was sweeter than I expected but still good. Finished with fried bananas! The atmosphere is nice, nothing too fancy, but you could bring a date here.

I frequently visit the Tria on 18th St and love it but I was looking to try one of their other locations. I'm a big fan of their Claudio Panini but this time I ordered their Prosciutto Cotto Panini and it was just okay. It was a little bit spicy and I definitely felt like I was missing out on something. Other than that the atmosphere at Tria is wonderful and I will always go back!

Me and my family are regulars here ... Why? Well we live around the corner and when we want a good meal we come to Meadows. Everyone in Blackwood knows Meadows and if you're a true native then you'll love it. 

The only one small tiny minute thing that bothers me is when the owners are yelling at their staffing that hushed way and telling them to clean this or get that. It ruins the overall ambience of the diner experience. 

Besides that -- THEIR TOPS!!

Let me start off with a simple but strong OMG! 
The pizza was delicious, staff were friendly and the restaurant appeared clean. We stayed nearby at Carpentaria beach and stayed in our travel trailer, we walked to Smart & Final for some supplies and walked by Pizzaman Dan's and decided to order a pizza and pick it up on our way back. Medium pepperoni was $18 but feeds 2-3 people about 8 slices. Definitely the best I've had in a long time! Eat here, you will be pleased!
Outstanding- first the service was great friendly and natural type homely feeling. Salads tasty and fresh, and French dip to die for.

I have been here twice and were quite disappointed by the inconsistency in quality. The first time everything was great. We ordered grilled chicken, lamb, and shrimp. The last one is exceptionally well done so I ordered it the second time I was there. But it turned out to be burnt and a little too salty for my taste. 

Besides this, I love the atmosphere and the price is very reasonable. Will give it another try.

Coffee drinks are great, I hear they have a hot chocolate bar on Saturdays right now that I have to check out too! That being said, stick to the drinks! I ordered a breakfast sandwich and the egg on it was a hardboiled egg, heated up, with cheese on it. I'm gagging thinking about it! It was awful. I'll be back for coffee but that's about it.
Great culinary experience!!! Outstanding service!!! Just really awesome experience! All the food and even the dessert were great!! One of the highlights of our food road trip. Thanks!

My husband and I have heard terrific things about R2L for years. Growing up near Philly, we have admired the building from afar. As we rode the private elevator to the 137th floor, our expectations were high - and the staff didn't let us down! 

The Valentines Dinner was a set menu. The servers asked that we order our appetizer, entree, and dessert at the same time. With so many guests for the holiday, it was a wise decision for the evening. It was difficult to choose because everything sounded so delicious. Where else can you get shrimp cocktail AND lobster for your appetizer? I could have ate just that and been satisfied. The courses came out in a timely fashion, everything was the right temperature and cooked exactly how we asked. My husband had the veal and I had the steak. We caught each other chewing with our eyes closed and a big smile after every delicious bite to fully enjoy every moment. 

During our meal, we received a complimentary appetizer and dessert. This was way more than expected and I was especially excited because I had trouble choosing between two desserts. The free dessert was actually my second choice, which I happily devoured as well. The Assistant General Manager, Brittney, approached our table and asked about our experience. With full bellies and smiles from ear to ear, we could not stop talking about how amazing the food and service was. But there was one problem - we wanted to get a photo of us with the beautiful Philadelphia skyline below, but we did not want to interrupt other customers dinners. When we mentioned this to Brittney, she personally took us to a private room so that we could get our picture taken. Just like how everything else in the restaurant was above and beyond, Brittney took the time to take several photos with and without flash, horizontal and vertical, just to make sure we were happy. I must say, we are more than happy! We were treated like we were the only guests in the restaurant and we are already talking about coming back for happy hour ASAP! 

FYI if you are considering reservations for  next year - The reservation process for Valentines Dinner was different than I have experienced. When we called in December, we were put on a list of callbacks for when they opened the books   for 2/14 in January. When we were called back, we were asked to make a $50 deposit to reserve a table (which went to our total bill at the end). That is totally understandable considering the type of place and popularity of the night! 

Also there is a full-size mirror in the restrooms so that you can snap a selfie in your fancy attire. If I could give this restaurant 10 stars, I would. You'll feel like a celebrity as soon as you walk off the elevator.

Wow!  This will now be a regular stop for the family whenever we're driving through. Feels like you're at a friend's house, hanging out in their backyard for lunch.  Nice big open lawn, play area with sand pit for the kids, and a very relaxing feel.  Food wasn't great, but i don't think you're necessarily coming here for that.  Actually, it's probably nice that you don't have to pay $15 for a burger.... Just an easy relaxed spot to hang out and enjoy a quick meal.
Excellent, very fresh, great tasting pizza, highly recommend, much better than other local pizza joints

A star for the outdoor patio, and a star for a decent oak-grilled burger.

But then . . . inattentive service, average food at best, and draft beer served small glasses just makes me wish I hadn't tried a new restaurant.

One last comment . . . the mussel broth tasted like rinse water from a stockpot. Really Disappointing!

Life is too short to review 1 and 2 star establishments.
We have been going here since I was a child. Delicious food, and reasonable prices. This is a diamond in the rough. Will always be a fave.

Here it was Sunday. My wife and I are shoping. It's close to lunch time so we decided to try CBQ. We went up the stairs and were a few minutes early before they opened. We decided to wait. Sign says open at 12:00. We are waiting with 10 others to go in. 12 comes and goes. Still locked up. There goes 4 people. 12:05 comes around and 2 more leave. 12:10 and 2 more go. My wife and I are still waiting(Not very happy). 12:15 off we go. And BJ's BBQ was much more tastier. Maybe because the employees wouldn't open up. I can wait around for a few minutes but who knows when they opened the doors. 10 potential customers walked away. A friend recommended CBQ and I called him to complain. Would e-mailed them but when you click on the e-mail on the website it calls them. Think I want to talk to someone that didn't want to open the doors? Well, this is one place I will never go again.

Loved Luke. Literally everything was delicious: we had the Brussels sprouts (a bit overly glazed & sweet for my taste, but it really was good), fried oyster salad, and the shrimp & grits. EVERYTHING was good! My favorite, though, was the French#75 cocktail...which was super delicious!! Our waiter was even so kind, he gave us the recipe for the Brussel sprouts! Overall-with all the NOLA options, this should make it on your list. I didn't do happy hour here, but they supposedly have a great one!

For a standalone casino, this was a pretty nice place. We found a good amount of choices for food and drink, servers came around to the slots regularly and alcohol was a fair price. There is a decent selection of slots, though none of the really newer, grand ones (ex. Game of Thrones). We experienced good payouts and left winners.
The Service was impeccable and the food was scrumptious! My 2nd dining experience here and we will be going back for many more delicious and enjoyable meals!!

Was in town for a conference and decided to bail on the stuffed shirt events and head out for something more low key.  A short walk landed us at the Pearl Street Pizzeria & Pub.  The place wasn't crowded on a Thursday night but the server was attentive and the bar selection was great.  Cheesy bread sticks were yummy and the pizza was tasty.  It was a welcomed change from all the formal networking events.  A comfortable place to grab some decent pizza, a great beer, and stroll around downtown.  I'll definitely head back the next time I am in the neighborhood.  If I lived nearby, I could see this a a regular hangout kinda place.

I was disappointed. I hated that very much because I was so excited to visit. My servers were overwhelmed for no reason because the place isn't big enough to bring an overwhelming crowd. I ordered the banana French toast and it  was basically slop on my plate, not sure if that's the norm but I was not impressed. We did order a bottle of champagne which was $25 and came with unlimited juice, I think it would have been better on both ends to simply charge a flat fee for bottomless mimosas. I spent the majority of my visit mixing my own mimosa, not ideal for a Saturday brunch.

I have lived in Philly most of my life and have always gone to Pat's, Geno's, Tony Luke's, and Jim's which has been my favorite. I just recently went to Joe's for the first time and I was blown away by the cheese steaks -- the rolls make all the difference -- fries and milkshakes. The staff was so nice and even took time to chat with us. Sorry, Jim's. Joe's may very well now be my favorite.

Was leery of coming here after I had heard about the unsanitary way they store and handle their fish, but I thought I'd give it a try anyways. The waitress brought out only 3 menus for the four of us - completely ignoring my daughter. This place isn't exactly kid friendly. The price range is average for a restaurant like this. The miso soup was so bad I didn't finish it, and I usually LOVE miso soup! I ordered the Ichiban roll, but had a hard time eating it since the seaweed wrap was so tough the roll just kept falling apart whenever I would try to chew through it. I originally was going to stay for sone green tea ice cream for dessert - but it got too cold in the restaurant. The people who were with me agreed it was cold and one person put their sweater back on. They do have an Axxess discount, but this only applies if you will be ordering 2 or more rolls. On the upside: nothing. This place has no redeeming qualities.

Awesome!!This was my boyfriend and my first time. We asked alot of questions. And still our waiter was awesome. Ohh!And he was training by the way.and still rocked. We had pork belly sliders,crab cake platter,mussels. Omg etc. I cant wait to go back. 7-5-16 awesome day

Being on a 1.5 day tour to NOLA is just not enough to devour the amazing food it offers. I was lucky to find atleast one great spot on the last day of my trip. Although a bit expensive worth each of your hardearned(hopefully) penny

BBQ Shrimp, although as a biased person for spicy food, BBQ dishes don't go down well on me. Give me this dish and I'll devour it like crazy any point and anywhere - it is AMAZZZZING, period. All the mess that you might have while eating is beyond worth, you gotta have it.

I ordered the Blackend Fish and ordered it a bit spicy. If fish is to be made, it better be made to the goodness of this extend and above. The other friend of mine who ordered some stupid croissant chicken sandwich ended up eating half of my fish (WTF), couldn't blast him as it was his bachelor party. 

One of us got a sausage potato dish which was pretty good too.

Verdict - I am sure everyone from NOLA or who visits NOLA will have his/her own favorite. This is undoubtedly mine and I am sure there will be very places that can make that BBQ shrimp.

This is my first visit to Henry's Coffee Bistro and I really like it.  I mobile office all over Indy and I have my favorites. But I struggle sometimes downtown to find a good spot where I don't feel rushed, don't have to pay for parking (over and over), and I like the atmosphere/food/crowd.  I can check off all of those at Henry's.  Today, I met a friend for a quick meeting, enjoyed the B.L.T. Bagel (which was very tasty) and got some work done.  I was expecting coffee, tea and baked goods, but the menu is pretty expansive. Lots of drink and breakfast choices, sandwiches, salads, paninis and desserts. The ladies at the table next to me are discussing a new project and are really excited about it, there's a table with a team working on what looks like some graphic design and a suit in sitting by the window scanning his iPad.  Nice crowd! I'll be back to Henry's to pay some rent next time I'm downtown.

A solid 3.  Amigos serves good tasting fresh American-Mexican food in a strip-mall type setting.  The Margarita follows standard protocol admirably.  The guacamole is a bit salty and has a lot of garlic in it.  The house salsa is very good.

Great food, I've had the half rotisserie chicken a few times and it's delicious & a decent price. The cornbread pudding is bomb and I also enjoyed the pulled pork sandwich. They offer a variety of bbq sauces, one hot, one sweet and one mango I believe. Only beer and wine, no liquor. Not a problem with me beer & bbq go hand in hand. My only issue has been the slow service. Great casual restaurant!

Decided to stop in for a bite an ordered the Southwestern Wings an the Crabby Corn  quesadilla. The Wings are Spicy, not sure why cause they should only have cilantro, garlic, olive oil, an lime ..according to the menu. The quesadilla was fine but needed some sour cream or dipping sauce on the side. It's dark in here also very dark.
Great food. Great service, great atmosphere. We had a variety of menu items and every one was amazing! Fabulous cocktails as well! Loved the Golden Claw!  Will definitely be going back!!

If you really enjoy Szechuan or always wanted to try it, this is the place for authenticity. Szechuan is very spicy Chinese food where you'll see plates where it looks like all peppers but food is buried in it. Szechuan house tones it down a little. Now this is different than most peppers that just burn you, Szechuan is said to burn but then numb and then makes you want more. I can't say I have specifically felt this but others I have gone to Szechuan House with have experienced this and ate more and loved it. This is also a place for adventurous eaters as they have menu items that you cannot find on most Chinese menus and items you may find bizarre but for most Asian eaters they are not. You can explore on your own. You know a good restaurant by its clientele, on most nights there are all Asians and their families eating there so that is good. I am Chinese but my Caucasian friends were definitely in the minority.

The exterior of the restaurant may look a little dated but you are here for the food right? And the food is really quite good. The go to every time is the Chongqing Spicy Crispy Chicken under the Chendu Classics on the menu. Nicely crisp pieces of chicken smothered in peppers, to me not burn your mouth off hot but a nice heat. Now I am not a huge fried rice guy not but I really really like their fried rice. It has its own flavor that I enjoy so these two are always a must have. One thing with me, even with fried rice I have to have a bowl of white rice this helps with some of the heat while eating the szechuan dishes.

I am a huge fan of beef chow fun (a wide noodle) but it has to be done right with a chewier texture and cooked really brown. This chow fun is a bit more soft and not as brown so not a big fan here. We also had a whole fish cooked with Szechuan sauce but this I would not recommend because of the bones. Most fish you can separate the flesh from the bones easily bit this was a gloopy hot pot of fish and spices so the bones were difficult to deal with. Better to go with a filet or fish cubes. Otherwise it was still tasty.

We have also had the peking duck which comes with the bun wrappers and scallion and hoisin sauce and although delicious it is $32 and you maybe got 6-7 small wraps out of it. If you've never had it worth a try just to say you've had it. The crispy skin and duck with everything in the wrapper is a very famous Chinese delicacy.

I have been to No Anchovies more times than I can count. It's one of my favorite places to grab a slice and a beer. At $3.75 for a gourmet slice, that's definitely not breaking the bank. They have some pretty yummy options, too. From their Mediterranean to their baked potato pizza, I always leave happy and full. I always find a beer that I like there, too. 

While I usually opt for a single slice, their pizza prices aren't bad either. $16.50 for a 16" gourmet? Once again, not breaking the bank.

They also deliver, too!   All in all, I would recommend trying this place out at least once. It's a pretty chill place with a nice patio and cool employees. Yay!

I've gotten the greek salad from here twice...the second time the lettuce was meh.  But they don't skimp on the feta, and that's my kind of salad.  The office says that the sandwiches are very good, although I've yet to try.  I'd be interested in trying the salad bar if I ever dined in.  They do have a pretty spacious dining room.  If you're ever interested in going, check out what specials they have going on.  Apparently yesterday was 1/2 off burgers, when the burgers are already $3!

This was a GREAT find. We went for a Sunday brunch of heirloom tomato salad and croque madam's. But possibly better than the food was the service. Roselyn took such excellent care of us that we had to call over the manager and make sure he knew how wonderful she was. We were treated like guests in the house of an amazing chef.

We just left Sam's and we're a little dissatisfied.  Atmosphere and server were decent but that was about it. I ordered a grouper sandwich that said market price on the menu. Maybe it was my fault for not asking but maybe they should disclose too. 18 dollars for a mediocre grouper sandwich is unacceptable. Then the manager said it's up to the owner and sorry about your luck. I guess they have enough business and don't need repeat customers. I've never had a grouper sandwich for over 12 dollars and I think saying "market price" is just a way to rip people off. Keep your 18 dollar sandwich. We won't be back.
Coffee was delicious. Being from out of town and my first visit I had no idea that this was more "self service".

Let me start off by saying the biscuits here are amazing! Best I've had in a very long time. I ordered the S.E.C. My only complaint would be I didn't care for how the sausage was prepared. Though the sausage was seasoned well, I like my sausage patties crispy on the outside but that's just my preference. This seems to have been cooked in an oven maybe? Makes the sausage seem a little mushy. I just didn't eat the sausage. Over all really good though. Throw the sausage on a griddle or in a skillet like my grandma and you'd get five stars!
Great food, location and decoration but service was a little slow. Servers were really nice though. Coffee is really good and you should definitely try some of their pastries.

I love Gypsy! The food and atmosphere are great. The restaurant and bar always have a great energy. I always order the buffalo chicken egg roll appetizer. The balsamic chicken is one of my favorites and you get a sizable portion. Sometimes the service here is mixed which is why I give gypsy 4 stars instead of 5. For the most part though service is usually good too!
Standard bar and grill fare, nothing special but if it's convenient that's fine.

I've only had Culver's a few times-the best part for me is always the fries! This little drive-in restaurant in the tiny town I grew up in had the same kind; they are crinkle cut, but thin. Delicious. This time I had the tenderloin, which was not quite up to my Hoosier standards. It tasted good, but something was off for me on the texture. I like thin breading, and this was a bit on the thick side. I have had the fish sandwich on my only other visit to Culver's, and it was good. Fries are where it is at.
It is a bit more expensive than standard drive thru, but they make it when you order. You may have to wait a few minutes longer than a normal drive thru, too. I will wait for fresh food. :)

I love tapas, and I loved Modesto! Came here with my bff and her parents over the summer, and I can't believe I didn't review this place immediately. Her family has been coming here for some time, and, after eating here, I understand why!

We had the special sangria of the day- it was pineapple and was delicious. There were 4 of us, and we ordered enough food to feed at least 6 people, but we made it work. :) The highlight was definitely the pork belly that we loved so much we needed to order two. We also had a mixed paella that was outstanding- I don't typically like rice, but this was delicious. The texture was awesome (crunchy rice on the outside, and well-cooked, toothsome rice on the inside), with lots of yummy everything spread out throughout the dish.

I will note that our server was a bit strange and not very on-top of our table, but we enjoyed the experience anyway. He did seem to be giving other tables better service, so I don't think this is a widespread issue, and I can admittedly be pretty picky about servers.

Can't wait to go back the next time I'm in St. Louis!

I admit I was a little shy of the adventurous menu.  But it was all very tasty.  We had the curry goat with sweet potato gnocchi and the triple pork entrees.  We started with the hamachi appetizer, which I thought was a little overpowered with flavors for such a mild fish, but tasty nonetheless.  
To be honest, the free biscuits and bacon butter were awesome, and I would come back just for that.

In days past, I used to get my wings from pizza places, chain restaurants, fast food joints, bars,  or your run of the mill diners that truly have no ideas on how to properly make wings whatsoever. Only when I had visited this glorious establishment, had I tasted wings so delicious and tasty, that I became both a new fan and frequent visitor. I speak of B-Dubs, known as Buffalo Wild Wings of Downingtown.

My first visit was with a group of friends I have through roller derby. As time went by, I brought other friends, boyfriends, and even my Mom, who loves the Buffalito with salad for lunch. Me? Major fan of the boneless teriyaki wings with fries, vegetable boat, and ranch dressing. 

And sports ? They have you covered. Hockey, football, basketball, soccer, golf...you name it. All played on dozens on flat screen televisions around the dining area and bar. Definitely a must during each season.

Like a challenge? Be brave and try their Super Hot Wings Challenge. Eat twelve super hot wings in under six minutes and score a t-shirt and ultimate bragging rights.

Good food, good drinks, great friends. What more could you ask for?

Visited NOLA for the day and was craving a burger. The atmosphere at Bayou Burger was awesome, burger not so much... We were served by a gentleman named Brandon who made all the difference at this restaurant. Probably best service you will find in NOLA.

Decided to have a night cap and grabbed a seat at the bar. Boyfriend had the beer flight,  I had the biggest little city gimlet. He liked the emigrant the best. The depot smells like new wood and the lighting is romantic, Thomas Edison romantic. My gimlet was refreshing and the bartender spanked the basil with such pizzazz. Took a peak behind the bar and was impressed by all the quality and care the bartenders took in the products used in their drinks. They even use high end heavy whipping cream. (I saw it myself) 
         I like this place and will return to try more drinks. The bartenders are super nice and take a lot of pride in their drinks. Classy.

I went here last night with some friends. Since when do they allow smoking INSIDE the bar. GROSS. I couldn't enjoy the band last night because of all the smoke. Also I stood at the bar for 15 mins trying to get a drink. The girls bartending kept skipping over me and served the guys. One guy literally walked right up and got his drink. Finally I was like um EXCUSE me I would like I drink! That's not the first time I've been treated like garbage by their female bartenders. 
*another crappy update: I just noticed that someone added a dollar tip to a drink I bought on New Years. I had one drink there and KNOW that I did NOT leave a tip.
i looooooove this place.  Great food and drink, not bad prices, and most importantly: the kindest, most attentive, but not annoying staff ever.  I can't wait to go back.
The food was good, albeit a little overpriced, and the service could definitely be better.

Beautiful ambience...,.excellent tapas dishes.....wonderful server.  Tried just enough dishes to fill all three of us ladies up.

The shrimp & grits were awesome.  Goat cheese was delish.  Drinks were tasty and fab!

A must try spot for any age.

Off the beaten path, the only "storefront" on the street which would lead it to be as quiet as it is in there. Very few other customers in there so service was pretty quick and courteous.

Food was okay. Not a whole lot of major taste bud popping flavors to the pizza or sauce. 

My major issue was that the wait staff and bartenders (due to the slowness) seemed more interested in conversing than worrying about their tables. The staff was eating snacks in plain site of the customers, kitchen staff was chomping down on something as he was making people's food. I also saw one of the staff start picking pieces off a leftover pizza from a customer that left. Instantly made everything no longer appetizing after I saw all this and wanted to leave.

Great breakfast served all day. Wife got the standard and a mocha and she was happy with her meal. I got the breakfast tacos and they were good. Not quite like the braised brisket tacos I had in Houston, but they were a good breakfast choice!
Definitely a hipster vibe, but as I walk around this area, I have come to realize that I am just smack dab in the middle of hipster Nashville. Not a bad thing, just worth pointing out!

I was a little wary of this place since its Yelp reviews are so wildly mixed, but I figured it was worth a shot with a Groupon, so last Thursday evening I drove out from center city to meet a friend who was coming from Norristown. Much to my surprise--and rather unlike many earlier reviewers--I neither loved nor hated it; I thought it was very much just "okay." The food was good, but I don't think I would have been too thrilled about the prices absent my Groupon. The service was remarkably friendly, but I think that was in part because we were new faces and the restaurant seems to be trying very hard to elevate their image and attract regulars. The interior of the restaurant itself isn't great--the lighting is weird (sort of a muted fluorescent?), and the tabletops are plastic--but there was nothing really "wrong" with it and we were plenty comfortable.

If I lived closer to KOP, I'd probably hit it up again for takeout. Highly recommend that if you go, you either bring or at least mention the Groupon deal to get a nice discount!
Pretty decent Chinese food. We had the Gemini and general Taos.  Could have been spicier but next time we know. And quick

We enjoy coming here.  Great food, good service and the view of Bourbon street always entertains.  Étouffée is delicious and the oysters any way you get them are fresh, big and tasty.  My favorite are the BBQ oysters--fried, sauced and sprinkled with blue cheese.  Hubs love the Parmesan encrusted broiled oysters.

This place has way more TeeVees than I thought--about five or six. But they are relatively unobtrusive. Though the sound gets LOUD in here when it's full, just from conversation. I tried the Portobello/Gouda open-face sandwich this time. It was pretty delicious, but, just as the salad I tried the first time had way too many candied walnuts, a copious application of garlic aioli threatened to overwhelm the sandwich. There *is* such thing as too much of a good thing.

Great breakfast spot right off the main street of Clearwater Beach. There's outdoor seating to enjoy when the weather is nice. We went in December so it wasn't crowded, we were seated immediately. The service is quick and accommodating. The food options are great as well and the brunch cocktails are delicious! Vegetarian friendly.

We parked at the Amtrak station and walked up State St. checking Yelp and the other reviewers rated it highly. Great breakfast, fast service, breakfast selections is fairly simple and what they do they do very well. Our order was brought out to the patio and our server checked to make sure we had everything we needed, and then returned a second time to check if we were satisfied. Not a fancy place, just good food.

I have now been here three times and the pizza is pretty good.  We went the first weekend they opened. They were slammed and I waited too long for my pizza  I swore I would never go back, but the pizza was just too good.  I recommend dining in.  An excellent choice before heading over to the movies.
Good coffee but overpriced in my opinion. I know it's all about being organic and earthy, but be prepared to bring your own splenda.

We had a large party in the back room tonight and everything was fantastic. Our server (Katherine) was so good. No one ever had a empty glass and she was on top of everything. The food and atmosphere was great and all the employees were so kind. Zero complaints. Can't wait to go back!

My wife and I brought some friends to Delicia for dinner on a Thursday evening (6-2-16).  We were the first to arrive, so we were immediately seated in the area across from the bar.  The restaurant was very stylish yet inviting.  
  We also had great service with a combination of friendliness and knowledge that I wish more restaurants had.  After all, the social aspect of dining with friends can be as key to enjoying the evening as the food.
  After ordering our beverages, we were brought a small cup of Sancocho as an amuse bouche.  I am not familiar with the item, but the flavor reminded me of tasty bean broth.  
  We then shared a guacamole for the table.  Excellent flavor combination in the guac.  My wife, who normally doesn't care for avocado, even thought it was good!  The chips that came with the guac were light, but crisp enough to scoop.
  I ordered the "De Palmitos" salad (hearts of palm, field greens, roasted walnuts, butternut squash, hibiscus-lemon vinaigrette).  It was my first time trying hearts of palm, so having all these other delicious flavors gave me confidence to try something new.  I was very pleased.
  Finally, I ordered the Pescado Zarandeado (it comes without the fish head....I asked.)  The sea bass was colored/flavored with green and red achiote which made for a nice presentation.  Very tasty.  The fish came with black beans and white rice to fill out the entree.  
  With the great atmosphere, service, and food, it was plain to see why this restaurant was voted one of the Top 5 restaurants in Indy.  I look forward to my next visit.

Review #6

Have been there for dinner on a friday and were seated immediately and appropiated. Waitress was very attentive and patient and the food (especially the appetizer) was delicious. Unfortunately the wine prices were much too high for a wine bar and the served volume, so I switched to beer after one glass of wine.

The food is decent. Not great, not bad. Fairly priced. I also think they might be rationing napkins. The dining area and parking lot are not very fun. The drive thru line goes right through the middle of the parking lot. Waited 5 minutes to back out and leave. Seating is scarce and the lines to order and pick up might as well be sitting on your lap. I won't tell you not to go. You might like it. It just wasn't for me.

Another Brennen restaurant, $$$$$ but good.  I had the Bar B q shrimp and my hubby had the bacon wrapped shrimp with grits.   We loved it.  The bread was just ok that they serve at the table.  The bread that came with the shrimp was much better.  Service is just ok,  You have several people waiting on you, one would say I will get the drink, then the next one would say it and then you had to ask where the drink was.  LOL  Dessert I had pecan pie, it was so yummy, crust was a little overcooked and hubby had white choc brownie, he loved it.
Inside and outside seating. Full bar. Yummy pot pies on Wednesdays only. Other than that, try chicken & waffles or the club (comes with deviled eggs!)

Excellent Ribeyes.  Also love the dinner rolls with the cinnamon butter.  The staff do a cool dance around dinner time and actually look like they enjoy it.  Great place to eat and it looks like a fun place to work

Honestly, my husband and I will never go back here. Yes, the peanuts on the ground are fun and the rolls are pretty yummy...but the food was just so bland. We both had a steak. I had the filet and my husband had the strip (I think). The best part of our meal was the server. She is the only reason I'm giving 3 stars. Oh and the cheese fries. Those were tasty. It would probably be 2 stars otherwise. 

Side note: My husband went to the bathroom and on his way and saw the cook. He said she looked miserable back there. Oh and I thought the whole restaurant smelled a little funny. Can't put my finger on it. I have been to other Cody's location (years ago) and had fabulous experiences. So maybe it's just this location (which is a shame because it's right near our house). But I would still be hesitant to go to another location now. I would hate to spend the money and have the same experience.

Don't bother coming here for happy hour. It doesn't exist. We had read a NOLA.com article raving about their happy hour. However, when we asked about the small plates served at happy hour, we got glared at as if we had 3 heads. "Um, the kitchen only serves dinner...and it doesn't open for an hour...do you have a reservation??...and could you speak up because I can't read your lips because of the glare from the windws?" You get the picture. Rude bartender, rude hostess, rude atmosphere. Tip: be nicer to locals...we tip better, can be regulars when otherwise the tumbleweeds are rolling in your bar, and we can spread a good or bad word very fast.

I haven't eaten here yet, but had their samosa at one of media's street fairs. Anywhere I see a samosa I will buy it, so I have tried a lot of samosas. This was by far, the best one I have ever tasted. Light, soft, fluffy potatoes, gently spiced, lightly fried, with a side a tamarind sauce I never get anywhere else. Unbelievable. Most samosas are heavy, greasy, oily, ultra spicy. Which I also like of course, but this was just a huge step above that, never knew a 5 star gourmet samosa existed. Can't wait to try their other stuff.

I've experienced much better at their location on Speedway. I had the enchiladas and the sauce was very watery and hardly any on the plate. One of the enchiladas was practically dry tortilla. The chips and salsa are divine, I should of just filled up on those. Was very surprised at how empty the restaurant was on a Saturday night.

Excellent pizza and incredibly friendly staff. The pizza is flavorful but not overwhelming... A great all around taste. I recommend to try the Greek pizza with the kilt lifter beer. 

Had a good conversation with the owners and it seemed like everyone on staff took the time to make us feel welcome.

We WILL come again!
After having my meal at LKBBQ, came here to eat some donuts!! Their donuts were not as sweet and very good! Would come back!

If you like live music, seafood, good service,  and a great atmosphere, this is exactly where you need to be. This is my first time to the new location but I guarantee you that it won't be my last. We are sitting outside under an umbrella listening to Jimmy Buffet and drinking a pitcher of beer. Our bellies are full from the delicious, good sized oysters and tuna sashimi. Both were very tasty and hit the spot. Justin was our Johnny on the spot server and helped us order. I also saw him take care of a dog at another guest table so they are pet friendly as well. We will definitely be back and like it!!

First thing's first. I love this place. That being said, it's not without its faults -- faults that are more and more turning people off -- and I hope they work on fixing them. 

The Good:
--Holy crap the decor is amazing. Not one single detail was overlooked at this place (even the trash cans are adorable!), and that, to me, makes a huge difference. I'll happily pay $15 for a slice of cake if it's delicious AND I feel like I'm having an experience, rather than eating a delicious piece of cake in a soulless box. And boy is this an experience. You really do feel like you stumbled upon a quaint French bakery. There's literally nothing else like this in the city. I cannot rave about this enough.

--The dessert. Mostly. I've been four times: the first time was mind blowing. The second time was amazing. The third time was good but starting to slack, and the fourth time was... meh. The cake slices are expensive, but the portions are huge. I can put away some food, but I've never finished an entire slice, so think of it as paying for 2-3 servings of dessert. The icing on the black and white cake is not so great -- it's thick and generous, but mostly flavorless. 

--The food. I've done lunch there three times, and mostly it's great. Again, it's expensive -- but this time the portions aren't generous. Think a half sandwich (but a true half, not an oversized Indiana half), a small cup of soup, and a few forkfuls of salad. This is a great place to go for nibbles, but not so excellent if you're actually famished. 

The Meh
--THE SERVICE. Holy God, someone please train the girls that work there. They are terrible. Even their adorable pink aprons won't distract you from the truly terrible service. Every time I've been, I've had to actually instruct them to remove the empty plates and dishes after they've brought the new plates and dishes to the table, and even when I asked them to take away the plates, they looked at me as if they were incredibly confused. Once we ordered mimosas and were told it would be a few minutes while they juiced the oranges, which they said they hadn't done yet because they "just opened." We were there 45 minutes after opening, and it seems to be that perhaps a few oranges should be ready to prepare for the brunch crowd. In the end, we waited 30 minutes for that mimosa, and there was only the tiniest amount of orange juice in it. We actually got out entire brunch because the drink. Not okay. 

--The food. Yes, I know I put this in the good column earlier because it is mostly good, but it's starting to slack. The vinaigrette in my salad was incredibly tart and super salty, like someone accidentally dumped an extra cup of salt into the mix. Quiche arrived cold (and it was not supposed to be). The tomatoes on the caprese salad were mushy and flavorless. (If tomatoes aren't good that day/week, just don't serve them as an option.)

-The cost. I don't mind because I'm okay with paying for an "experience," but lunch for two (soup and salad), plus a soda and two slices of cake will easily put you over $40.

Still, I'll go back. The experience and decor make up for most of the mistakes, but I'd go even more frequently if I could count on solid service and improved food.

I've been wanting to try Livery for a while, and finally went last night with a Bachelorette party. What a disappointment! We had a reservation for 9 PM but our table wasn't ready. No big deal, we headed to the bar and ordered drinks. Our table opened up at 9:25 so we were good to go! Our server took our food orders first since we all still had drinks at that time. Around 10 we didn't have any food yet, and it started to rain so we quickly moved inside. They had a large table available that was able to fit all but 3 of us. So we just stood for about 15 Mins until I finally asked our server if they intended to bring us chairs so we could sit when our food came. They brought us seats and we squeezed in at the table. At 10:20 one of our guests asked the server for a drink refill - because in the 55 minutes she had been our server, she never ONCE asked if we wanted more drinks!! She took her order and started to walk away! I waved her back and said, I think our whole table would like to order drinks. Our appetizers were finally served at 10:25. An hour after we had been seated. Our drinks didn't come until 10:40... 20 Mins after we ordered them. Our dinner was not served until 11:05! Then those of us with skirt steak had the smallest little portions, and it was drowning in oil and butter. We only had a few bites because it was so oily. So... bachelorette party. Two hours for late night dinner service. Server only got us one round of drinks more than an hour after we sat down... completely killed the mood of the party! We had been at Tastings beforehand and had the most amazing service, incredible fun, and Livery brought the whole night down. We had 13 people to start... only 4 ended up continuing the party. The rest of us were sleepy and sober by then. We will not be back.

Zoës is absolutely, by far, the best Mediterranean/Greek food I've experienced. It's slightly expensive for my taste, but it's worth it. The kebabs, salads, cucumber, vegetables, and basically everything on the menu is AMAZING. I would come here every day If I could afford it. 

The atmosphere is what makes Zoës so unique and interesting. It's a modern, fun, exciting twist on Mediterranean/Greek food. The colors are bright, fun, and contemporary. 

I would 100% recommend. 

PS: The shrimp kabobs are a little spicy, but still great.

I went there to get a chicken kabob once and the guy working there was skewering the chickens like he was doing this job for years. I asked his name and he said Ali. He is the God of Kabobs, he is the best it was delicious. Everyone has to give at least a try and go eat at this place when Ali is working.
