Delicious food, mediocre service. I had the pork and dumplings, pretty non traditional but very filling and tasty. A friend had the Amish chicken and it was also very good. We shared the apple crisp with house made cinnamon ice cream - definitely the highlight, it was perfect! We had a lot of trouble choosing what to order because everything on the menu sounded delicious. I'll definitely be back to try something new. Was a little disappointed in the attentiveness of our server. We had to ask to refill our drinks twice and eventually asked another server for a dessert menu after not seeing our server for 15+ minutes. Overall, he was very nice when he was at our table, but I generally expect a little more. I will be back again soon!

We love AJ's! My husband and I visit Tuscan at least 6 times a year and stop at AJ's at least once during evey trip. We love their iced coffee, beautiful pastries, sandwiches and sushi! If the weather is good we enjoy sitting on the patio next to the fire. If you are looking for a gourmet grocery store or for a coffee while you shop at La Encantada,  I highly recommend a stop here first:).

Loved it here. Been meaning to come here for awhile. The bartender whose name I forgot to ask was amazing. Literally the only save after my experience downstairs and the only reason I'll ever eat at Felipe's again. We spent several hours here and had half a dozen drinks and some shots and gummies. We only left because if we stayed we were going to spend another hundred bucks. Honestly, will come back but 75% of the reason to see the bartender again. 

A year later.... wow. What happened to you guys? You guys updated the menu again by removing more items. It didn't exactly speed up the service. The best thing about the place is Michael, which was the only reason we came back, and to our dismay got stuck in a booth. Not that it mattered, he was so overworked and understaffed he wouldn't have been chatty and witty anyway. Another guy was there. Red shirt. Middle aged. Clearly worked there. I use that term loosely. He was only interested in other tables, literally every single other table besides ours until we ordered a $40 drink. Then we warranted passing attention. Shame it took thirty minutes to get that drink and another fifteen for the second and final drink. Seriously, get more staff. I'll probably be back but I'll call ahead to see who's working and if there's not room at the bar, I'll just go to Lucy's on Tchoupitoulas. They not only have great bartenders but they have the support staff necessary to run a bar. Michael, if you quit and go somewhere else - let us know; we'll follow you anywhere, even to The Saint.
Great dive bar!  It has cheap drinks and a great atmosphere.  If you are looking for something different and you like the dive bar scene, this is your place.

3 stars only because our waitress was so incredibly nice and accommodating (the woman from Michigan!) She helped us with our vegetarian dining requests and told us about all the many tasty beers on tap. We ordered the veggie burger which was very delicious but pricey. we also ordered the veggie bowl with quinoa but it was SO incredibly salty we had to send it back, something we never do. Our server graciously took it off our bill and offered to give us a new meal, which I just opted for a side of fries. The creamy poblano salad dressing is AMAZING I really really recommend it! Overall though extremely expensive for what it is.

I've eaten lunch here in the past and it has been very good.  Last night (a quiet Wednesday) was another story.  Four of us went after work for a birthday get-together.  We ordered simple items -- not the entrees.  It took 45 minutes to get the quesadillas which consisted of 4 small flour tortilla folded in half with maybe a teaspoon of cheese inside -- totally underwhelming.  My friend had a salad with seemed to consist of simply bagged lettuce with 2 slices of avocado and then we had to ask for dressing since it looked undressed.  The elote was ridiculous -- two dried ears of corn on a skewer which had been charred with really no sauce, cheese or anything.  There were maybe 8 other people in the restaurant and there were plenty of servers, so I don't quite understand why service was so slow -- other than the owner may have not been present.  

The restaurant is really nice and the ambience/atmosphere is fun -- but I wouldn't go back for that alone -- I need some tasty food and better service.

P.S.  Happy hour ends at 5 pm -- most people work till 5:00 downtown.
Love everything about this spot! Food quality and service is amazing and the menu has such creative options! La Colombe coffee to top it off. Would highly recommend!

We were looking for a place to rest and have a nice late lunch. The decor is simple but the food is amazing. We ordered shrimp and grits which were probably the best I've ever eaten. They were creamy, saucy, and perfectly seasoned. We also ordered a muffaletta which was gigantic but had to box it up because we were so full from sharing the shrimp and grits. 

We ate the muffaletta a few hours later and it was delicious as well.

Service was good.

I would definitely eat here again.
Staff was so nice. Food was really good. Atmosphere was incredible. Went back the next day and it was still amazing. Highly recommend.

Hubs and I went to eat and grab a drink last night at about 8 maybe. Wasn't too busy, normal amount of people. Our blonde waitress gave us menus and I ordered a beer to start and my husband said "I'll have a water to start while I decide what else I want." She brought my beer and never came back. She was literally 5 feet from us eating food, joking with customers, even making eye contact with me while I was holding up the menu. & nothing.. about 20 mins went by and she walked past us to go out to smoke. That's when we just had to go to the bar and pay for the beer and leave. We couldn't believe it.
Gd Afternoon I had Lunch with My Sisters today I had a Turkey Cheese Burger , Sweet Potato Fries And Coleslaw . The Food was Delicious. We enjoyed Ourselves. I do Recommend This Restaurunt

I've been the this Marathon a few times for breakfast. It was crowded but we didn't have to wait too long for a table. The service was good and friendly. I loved the southwestern breakfast wrap and the parfait was awesome. Not to mention the delicious bloody marys, also :)

The breakfast was such satisfaction, I can't wait to go for dinner soon!

It's nice that Blue Duck is trying something more creative in the Northeast. The atmosphere and decor is very comfortable and laid back, with a menu that makes you feel like you're downtown. Their menu is a mix of comfort food with a dash of elegance. 

When they first opened I loved going there, especially for their blue duck fries. The past few times, the food has been hit or miss. The last time I went, I ordered the fried chicken and it was burnt to a black crisp. I actually ate a piece or two thinking that was the way it was supposed to be but it was clearly burnt after all.

When I approached the manager, I let him know that I was a big fan of the restaurant but my chicken was black, not too get a refund but just to let him know what happened. I was met with a, "Ok thanks" and then I left, feeling like an idiot. I'm never one to complain but I really like the place so I was more so giving them a heads up.

I'll give it another shot but hopefully their noses aren't too stuck in the air. I'm interested in trying their brunch as well.

This is a nice little Italian restaurant in downtown West Chester, they have a great lunch buffet for less than $10, the food was fresh and flavorful (warning no sneeze guard). The place is however, small crowded and loud and the seemed to be a little understaffed. 

I would give 4 stars for the food and value and 3 stars for the crowd, service and noise.

Delicious breakfast while in NoLa. Service was great.. it's a tiny place, but they make it work. Also, you can add yourself to the wait list and they will text you when your table is ready, which is great because it's on Royal St. and there are many shops and galleries to check out next door.

On a Florida Gators Football Game Night, this place is five stars. 

I wouldn't recommend it any other time. Head south to the Undertow unless the Gators are on. 

$10 buckets and $.50 wings during games.
Food was yummy. Really enjoyed my breakfast. My cousins enjoyed their breakfast as well. Everyone had a yummy experience. Will definitely return when in town.

Cocktail review only
The drinks were ok. The ginger mint julep was pretty bad. The view, however, is great & the upstairs lounge is really fun. The balcony is gorgeous overlooking Jackson Square.

I was very impressed with Muriel's. We went for the Sunday Jazz Brunch. 

The staff were kind and helpful.

I got the title soup and the duck hash. Both were perfect.

My boyfriend got the tomato and mozzarella and the eggs Benedict, also perfect!

I got the red velvet ice cream sandwich and that was the only thing that was not good. If I could I would give place 4.5 stars.

The music and ambiance was also just right!

Oh and I forgot to mention the bread, OMG by far my favorite bread ever.

Mr. B's is a pretty good meal with some strong spots, and some definite weak spots.  We showed up about ten minutes early to our reservation and grabbed a drink at the bar.  The drinks were pretty much par for any upscale restaurant's bar...a bit pricey and good but nothing clever or great.  The atmosphere of the bar is a bit crowded making it loud and a little unpleasant.  Still, the clientele and the bar itself was nice so this wasn't a big deal.

When we were seated, I was FREEZING.  I thought it was from my martini, but  I realized about half way through my meal when I stood up to navigate the corn maze to the bathroom downstairs that there was a vent blowing freezing cold air right above me.  Oh well.  On to the food....

I started with Gumbo Ya-Ya, which is this places staple.  It did for sure live up to all it's hype.  I'm no gumbo expert but this had a delicious, rich and smoky flavor, that was very well contrasting with the natural sweetness of the chicken and broth.  It balanced smoky, salty, and sweet in excellent layers.  I ordered a scallops appetizer because I didn't want anything fried (seriously what's the deal...only like 1/7 appetizers wasn't fried).  I knew my entree would be heavy so I opted for this, and it wasn't a great dish.  The fried oysters and shrimp were much more flavorful.

My entree was the braised rabbit which was a really nice dish.  It was almost unfairly sweet and about half way through it it just felt like I was forking through molasses.  I really was moving at a New Orleans pace.  I think this might have worked better as an appetizer because at this quantity it felt like there was no beginning and no end.  The bacon and mashed potatoes were delicious, but were all hampered by a very very sweet and thick sauce.  The filet was okay (but nothing great), and the fish of the day was pretty nice, but also nothing great, from trying off of other plates.

Overall, I think the food was four stars, but the limited dishes under 5,000 calories, the packed bar, and the freezing cold atmosphere detracted a star from my review.
Ice cream is pretty good and the espresso is ok. I recommend the black cherry. Bathrooms are clean and service is pretty good.

I'm a big fan. The ice cream is wonderful, as is the food.  I haven't met an ice cream martini there that I didn't like.  Try the dill pickle soup - it is very nice.  The homemade hot fudge is really amazing.  I highly recommend.  The service is good, but watch out for a show rush - it can get a little crazy...

I stopped in here for lunch last week and what a nice surprise!  The staff was very friendly, the atmosphere was relaxing, and the food delish!  I love thin crust pizza, and this pizza was special.  Coal fired, great sauce, a nice blend of quality cheeses... perfecto!  I'll admit, I went back 3 days later so the hubs could experience this.  They have craft beers, too, but I wasn't a fan of the oatmeal porter I had- maybe it was just too early in the day.  I would highly recommend this place!
Very happy birthday spent at J. Gilbert's.  The best crab bisque, scallops and creme brûlée.  Thanks for the birthday coupon as well.

Sooooooo....Went back for a friend's going away annnnnnd probably will never going back. Of course the seafood is always good but,,,, they raised the price so that the  one margarita was 9.99... i ordered a normal raiging steamer and 3 margaritas ended up paying alittle less than 70 bucks that was without the tip for the waitresses who worked their butt off to serve a big group . Of course the food is always slow as usual. There were only handful of tables but the food was still slow and oddley the drinks were super slow too.hmmmm some of the co-workers ended up ordering the drinks at the bar . Take away tips and raised the price.......Well done.Joe, well done.

Very quaint and exceptionally good restaurant.  Sunday afternoon special of Salmon Benedict. Excellent dish served on a croissant with hollandaise sauce and potatoes. Both had the same and were impressed. Also pumpkin fritters which were also great. Definitely a must try restaurant in north Tampa.  You won't be disappointed.           


Returned with my family for dinner. Not good. Food took about 45 minutes to come out and the sides were cold. Evidently played long before the main dish. Hopefully it was an off night but I'll have concerns about booking Michaels in the future. Backing off a star because of this visit. Very disappointed.

It's an IHOP, so I shouldn't have expected much, but this was lower than mediocre. I ordered the Tilapia which came with soup or salad. The soup was clam chowder. To their benefit, it came quickly, but whatever came was not clam chowder. It was some oily liquid with some chunks of potato. I sent it back and got the salad with vinaigrette on the side. The salad comes out, and it is basically lettuce with some tomato diced to the point you needed a spoon to eat it (think pick de gallo). And it came with a side of ranch. So I sent the ranch back and asked for my side of vinaigrette. He brought out bottles of separate oil and vinegar. Ok, we are getting there, but how am I supposed to use this without dousing my salad in it? There's no bowl or anything. I give up.  I try to muscle through and just ate the salad plain. The tilapia was nothing to write home about. I asked for lemon and hot sauce. That made it palatable. I should have just stayed home and cooked myself. It would have been faster, cheaper, and less taxing on my nerves.
Simple and tasty. The chicken was tender and favoring. The fries were filled with taste. A great place to go for a simple lunch. Fast and quick. The chicken tenders were mouthwatering and juicy.

Dinner at Muriels was the best meal I've had since I've lived in NOLA. (4 months)

They offer a 3 course dinner for $35 which is a great deal with the quality of food you get.   The atmoshpere is beautiful. I love the architecture and the history. Take a drink upstairs and relax. Beautiful view of Jackson Square from the balcony. 

I got the pecan crusted puppy drum. It was so good! and that crab hash thing they had going on under that drum was A-MAZING. I want that for breakfast with eggs! 

oh and the bread pudding?? Best in NOLA. nom nom nom

Had high hopes from reading the other reviews, but the service was lackluster and the rolls were not made well-they fell apart whether we used chopsticks or our fingers. There are definitely better sushi places in the city.

Very mediocre, even more so after having to wait 20 minutes after our reservation time to be seated on a weeknight. No where to stand either, so we had to wait outside. 

Bruchetta was probably the highlight of the meal. The proscuitto was average quality at best. The "salad" with it was a ball of mixed greens with dressing? Really? 

The pasta with a porcini sauce, was really an incredibly rich white sauce with porcini mushrooms (which in total, probably was a single cap, very skimpy). 

The crab was very fishy (needed salt & lemon for sure, some pepper wouldn't have hurt) and overcooked. The portions of this dish were 1/5 pasta, 1/5 crab and 3/5 tomato sauce.... 

Honestly, I had heard this place was a nice cozy authentic Italian BYOB. 

Also, the host mid-way through our meal turned on the radio behind my GF and it was literally the radio and not on a station. It kept going back & forth between music and static. 

Pay a bit more and go to Melograno. Raddichio's food is 10x better for the same price. La Viola is better than Porcini and cheaper as well...

Best fish tacos I ever had! These people know what they are doing - the sauces with the right toppings just amazing ! And the best margaritas to complement. I tried all the tacos but definitely regret not ordering more Mahi-Mahi tacos  they are a must !

We showed up without a reservation, and the maitre d' had no problem seating us.  He was cheerful and attentive.  Seems like most of the patrons are regulars!  Food was delicious, and plus we got free desserts for checking-in on Yelp!  The pastry dessert was divine.  I would skip the tiramisu.

Entree wise, I had the squid ink pasta ~ tasty, but not the best I ever had.  My hubby had the ravioli, and that was delicious.

If you want a no fuss good dinner, then give this place a try!

Overall a decent experience.  While I have had  better omlettes, the service was good, the restaurant was clean and the live music was good.  I made reservations and got there when it opened for brunch.   I probably would of been fine at opening to e without reservations.

I ordered tre rib eye medium it was definatly over cooked and that's such a let down from any steakhouse  also my steak was 45$ not including any sides this place is very expensive and service was not attentive & not the most polite! The steak was delicious but for 50$ we could have went to the Brazilian steak house! Wish it was more affordable and service could be a lot better.

Not much to say that hasn't been said.  I had the burger, which I suspect they use truffle oil on, and it was very tasty, along with an order of the philly cheesesteak eggrolls (you only get 2 for 10 bucks).  My only critique of the food was that the eggrolls had this thick, doughy wrapping that reminded me of some of the really cheap egg rolls I used to eat at my high school cafeteria.  Pretty happenin' place, though.

My husband and I stayed at the Royal Sonesta for our trip and Desire Oyster Bar is attached to it, so we ate breakfast here one morning.  The food is amazing!  I had traditional New Orleans Bananas Foster (yummmmmy!) and my husband had an eggs Benedict of some kind.  Service was great, environment was great and food even better!

This is the most innovative ice cream experience in the tri-state area. The idea of mixing your favorite cereal with some flavor-accompanying ice cream is unprecedented. Very family friendly environment and wonderful staff. Highly recommend the milk and cookies!
Nothing special at all. Didnt like the atmosphere all that much and there wasnt much bang for your dollar. Not terrible if you want lunch but not a dinner spot...

Great beer selection. However, we were disappointed with our meals (2 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 desserts). It was all rather boring and bland and did not meet the expectations based on the menu. Maybe lunch is better, but we won't be trying this place again.

Okay, super cool spot....do yourself a favor and get the mac n cheese skillet
.....omg!!! Amazing! Oh wait, gravy fries too! 
And Jessie is awesome!

I love this place!!! It's like the local watering hole. The bar is a great hang out spot and you feel at home. We ALWAYS get brisket nachos... There's no way my boyfriend would let us walk outta there without having an order. I'm not a nacho dish kinda gal, but this place has me hooked! I would definitely recommend this local favorite any day of the week. Their BBQ is by far my favorite in Nashville.

In town for the weekend for a soccer tournament and was looking for a good breakfast place and stumbled across this place.  My son ordered one of the platters with chocolate chip pancakes, scrambled eggs and two meats (bacon and sausage).  I ordered the eggs Benedict which came with Hashbrowns.  

First, let me start off with the place was packed.  The parking lot was full, the restaurant crowded, yet we were sat right away and the waitress was very prompt in greeting us and getting our drink order.  In fact she was one of the best servers I've had in a while.  She paid attention to when our drinks started to get low (I had hot tea and she got me more hot water before I had to ask), and checked on us just enough times.  

My eggs Benedict was great.  The hashbrowns could have been seasoned, but ham was flavorful.  It tastes like it had been grilled on an open grill, and the hollandaise sauce was plentiful.  I tasted the chocolate chip pancakes and they were fluffy and sweet without tasting like a candy bar.  

The only "bad" part of this review is that a teenager in line to pay with her family (we were seated near the register) had the music on her phone extremely loud and the owner/manager came up to my teenage son and asked him to turn it down.  My son politely told him it wasn't him, and the owner immediate apologized and we all laughed it off.  

We came back same day for dinner.  My son got the Cajun burger, we got waffle fries with cheese and ranch, and I got the open faced hot turkey sandwich with stuffing and mashed potatoes.

My son inhaled the burger so I'm assuming it was good.  The fires were tasty and you could tell they were homemade.  The ranch wasn't my favorite, but I'm a fan of hidden valley, so that's more of a personal preference thing.

The bread on my sandwich was slightly sweet, but tastes great with the stuffing.  The gravy needed a little bit more flavor, but I am partial to my moms turkey gravy, so I cannot fault the diner.  The only issue is that there was paper in my sandwich.  It appears the cooks missed removing the paper from the meat slices.  That was discouraging because we had such a great experience for breakfast.  The waitress did give us our dessert on the House, which I appreciated.  I would still come back here next time we are in town.  
My

This is probably our 8th time here in about 2 months. The classic gyro is legit. My wife had a Greek roommate for 8 years so I feel like she knows good Greek food. This is our "go to" when we're both hungry. If they had memberships, we'd be premium members lol. Delish

I've been hesitant to share my love for this place because I don't want it to get too popular and never be able to get a table...

I was fortunate enough to live in India for a time and loved the street food of the North and South. Since coming home to the states I have been looking for that same authentic experience.

The paneer 65 is delicious. The masala dosa is crispy, spicy and so savory. 

The Briyani is good but the speciality here is the fresh dosa and chat options.

They also make excellent lassis. The mango is my favorite. The dosa sandwich is also yummy but I prefer the simple curry, and potato magic of the more standard fare. 

The staff and service is also very good. The one thing I might change is this slightly bizarre smell of urinal cake in the entrance way. I'm not sure why it's so strong or smells of it in a hall way but it's always a bit of bracing oneself when you walk in.

In any case the food has soul and the experience as a whole is outstanding.

Cannot even give any stars for this place after tonight. I am a server/ bartender and have never complained once in a restaurant because I get it... but I have never been treated the way I was treated tonight. I understand the server was triple sat but to completely ignore us while we watch you interact with your other tables around us made us not wanting to come back to this place. Shame on you Drew. 
You started out great that lasted until after you took our drink order. Slamming our drinks down on the table and our plates down to where it makes us jump is unacceptable. 
I have been here only one time before and it was great  don't know what has happened. Food was decent cannot complain about the all you can eat can legs unless you want more than one side when it includes unlimited sides. My boyfriend never even got his original side we waited until we got the check and they magically appeared. 
Note to management: if you are going to have an all you can eat special, have the proper amount of help so your patrons are treated decent. 

Will not return ever my only night off in 2 weeks was wasted in this establishment and it cost me a lot. Sorry not sorry I didn't leave a bigger tip maybe u will learn better customer service skills Drew. 

Thank you for the worst evening I have had in years.
Not recommended if you are hungry. Unable to provide timely service. Food could be better for the time it takes to receive your meal. Also, they should not serve burned hash browns. Coffee was good.
We ordered the sweet potato and cinnamon & brown sugar donuts. Baked fresh and not too sweet. Great atmosphere and cool spot!

I'm echoing many reviewers here, when I say to you that I think that this location of HipCityVeg wins the day with its relaxing space and plenty o' seating. See, I always feel like a moose woman in a china shop anyway, or I'm carrying a huge bag that I'm trying not to hit into people with, or I just generally have some other ridiculous issue where a tiny shop can gimme a panic. So, the point is: ahhhh spread out a little. It's the same delicious vegan fast food stylins and salads from your original HipCityVeg; now with more leg room. 

Also, here's another thing, a sidenote to all this limited seating talk. I love the hell outta that udon salad, but I'm one of these people who seem to take forever to eat a damn salad. I have felt much anxiety, self-consciously imagining that those waiting to score my seat are hissing at me in their minds, "Jeeeeezus, just will this one just take it to go already." Neuroses. So you understand what I'm saying. You can at salads at your leisure, or enjoy sweet potato fries and crispy, crispy nuggets at their peak crispiness. Or both. Makes such a difference, I tell you: a lil extra space and maximum crispiness.

Speaking of making a difference- when they take the time to griddle a little char onto that seitan in the udon salad, I love that. It really gives the protein that grilly somethin somethin. I love it that this arrugula-y salad it's an actual greens-packed salad with noodles in it, rather than, you know, a bigg asss noodle bowl with some greens fluttered lightly in. Listen, I'm all for extra noodle, but, ya know, sometimes your trying to do a thing. Anyway, I enjoy this dish, I do, even if it could use a little less dressing at times. I'm not complaining bout that though, really. So tasty.

In closing, I'd like to repeat the announcement that the Crispy HipCity Ranch remains my favorite, favorite. It cures a chicken sandwich yen for me, maybe better than a real bird sandwich, even. I have real HipCityVeg hankerings and I find myself coming up with more reasons to head West to University City. Maybe I should go back and get that masters. Hurrrrhurrrr hurrrffff...

Hold the flies please! This was the worst I've ever experienced and let me tell you I been here plenty of time. 1st my mother orders  long island tea it came with garished fly 2. I ordered crab cake and it came with bacon. That wouldn't have been a problem if it was on the menu description but it wasn't and I do not eat pork. I mentioned it to the managment in a nice way and he kinda brushed it off. I want be going back no time soon....SORRY 2 THUMBS DOWN!
Great, fresh tasting coffee. Loved the friendly staff! The coffee is brewed to taste like real coffee and is not weak. It was delicious!

The gumbo and jambalaya are excellent.  The oysters are delicious as is the fresh horse radish.  The service was a tad slow but not problematic.  Don't wait in line at Acme when this better restaurant is two blocks away.

Congratulations Handle Bar! Bike themed bar on my way home from work that has amazing hand crafted pizza's (and other nosh), well selected local beers (at reasonable prices - that's all relative isn't it?), indoor bike parking, happy hour specials, 10% cycle-in discount, $2 mystery beers, nice patio (with fire pits), and friendly staff? Yes, please!

My unsolicited suggestions: Going to need more bike hooks if the place takes off (which I hope it does). A little too clean and sportsbar-ish (but I'll chalk that up to the newness). A little too well-lit in my opinion (perhaps fewer, more intentionally placed lights.) A little heavy on the tie-died-esque decor for my tastes (not just hippies that ride bikes). Lastly, Blues Traveler came up on the juke box. This shouldn't happen (otherwise the juke box seemed okay, albeit a little on the tame side.) This would be a great spot for a rotating cast of guest dj's providing background music.

I like!

I am a business traveler and always come here for lunch or dinner when I'm in town.  And sometimes I work on my computer while sipping a delicious latte. The food and ambiance are fantastic.  Fire pit at night with a delicious meal and a glass of wine - you can't beat it!! Oh and fantastic service every single time!!

Stopped in one night on our way from the casino. Thinking we can't go wrong with a diner. OMG were we right!!! I had the Philly cheese steak and he had the meatball sub. Both were outstanding and flavorful!! Service was great as well. Prices are good!! Definitely can't wait to visit again so I can come back.

The food was good, but nothing blew us away. We started with the chorizo queso appetizer. For entrees, my husband got the empanadas and I got the tacos de papa. We split the churros for dessert which was probably the highlight of our meal. We each got drinks, which were pretty good. 

Service was just okay. Our server gave us menu suggestions but it seemed like she was only trying to pitch the more expensive items on the menu without actually asking what our preferences might be. And even though she wasn't super busy, she didn't check on us very frequently. We weren't asked if we wanted another drink until after we had already ordered dessert and our drinks were long gone. 

I think the biggest disappointment happened after we got home - I opened up my leftovers the next day and found that they had only given me a small portion of what had been left on my plate! I had eaten, at most, a third of my entree in the restaurant. My leftover container only contained one taco with none of my sides included. I don't mind spending over $100 on dinner but I'd at least like to keep what I paid for.

May I start by saying we went for dinner on a Monday night and the restaurant was 3/4 empty. We were immediately seated but it took 10 minutes to get water. I asked how spicy one of the pizzas was and she said "I've never had it but I'd guess by the name pretty spicy". I said "could I get it without the peppers?"  Answer: "I guess". I ordered a different item and she seemed relieved? The food was very good. The service was not good at all. Is it a new thing to pay a lot for food and just expect bad service?

The food here is amazing, and the service is friendly and efficient. A big thanks to our server, Marybeth, and the manager who offered our bachelorette party free pastries for waiting. However, it was totally worth the wait!

We ventured in here last night for a quick drink and that's exactly what we did.  The table we sat at was sticky which was a bit of a turn off.  Had it been later in the night and several beers later, I doubt I would have noticed but it was still pretty early on a weekday night.  The thing that stuck me as being a bit odd was their selection of beer on tap was rather limited.  My beer was nice and cold which is always a good thing. 

The patio looked cool, so I may have to come back in the fall when the weather is more conducive to sitting on a patio and having a cold brew.  Then again, I have several other places in Soulard that I really like so I'm not sure if I will come back to give Nadine's a second go round.

Great service! It was busy and I got my food so fast. They were very nice. They helped me find a table for eight people and a high chair. They keep the restaurant so clean. They have several people making sure the restaurant is clean and getting extra sauces if needed. They were so kind and polite. The food was very good. My kids, friends and I loved it. My kids said the nuggets actually taste like chicken and not processed. We are definitely coming back.

The third time I've been here, I finally tried the fish. I had one fried (you have the option fried or tequila lime glaze) Mahi Mahi. It was great. The Chipotle Remoulade didn't overpower the flavor if the fish. They're bigger than the carne, carnitas, and pollo tacos, too. 

The only problem is that the Mahi Mahi was piping hot, but my carne and carnitas were cold. I figure this is because it might take longer to make the fried fish tacos, but if that's the case, they shouldn't make them all at the same time. They should start the fish, wait, and then cook the meats. 

I also noticed there was less meat and more toppings on the carne and carnitas than the other times I've been here. This could be because those times it was dead, and this time it was sort of crowded (10 or so customers already eating, then another 5-10 came in after I ordered).

But still, this isn't enough for me to deduct a star (they're a true 4.5 but I rounded up). Buena Onda is the best.

Decided to try this place on a whim....

When we walked in, the atmosphere was lovely. We were greeted and taken to a booth which was very nice. 

Our waiter, Victor, greeted us quickly and we ordered a glass of wine; Pinot Grigio for hubby and Sangiovese for me. We were served olive bread and a white bread with oil. My only thought about the bread service is that the oil was blah....no taste and no seasonings.

We ordered the carpaccio for the appetizer and it was delicious with capers, greens and oil. By this time, I'm noticing my wine is a little sour so I switched to the Pinot noir and it was perfect. Hubby had the Brancini fish and loved it.  The menu said gluten free and it came with seasoned spaghetti noodles. I had the Lamb shank which was served with rice. It was delicious with a savory sauce.

We did our check in and asked about a free glass of wine but it did not apply to our wine we'd already had. There were specific wines they want to use for that.

We enjoyed our dinner and Victor gave us just the right amount of attention.  Price point was right for servings and quality. We'll definitely go again.

Food was good for what you pay and is one business that gives you free birthday all you can eat with your rewards card and of course valid ID. Do call ahead for the full disclosure. 

Our server a younger boy with dark brown hair never introduced himself so it struck me as odd. My first impression was to get up and leave, my sister and I had filled out our card for our food and maybe our server thought he was being cute, but slapped off our table, but then picked it back up and said just kidding?? Do you do that with all your guests? I work in the service industry and that is a no no! You almost lost your tip for the night and another star. I will hand it to him that he was efficient so he sort of redeemed himself. 

 I will say, food came up quickly so the one sheet was more plentiful between the two of us. I will say, The Rock N Roll is disgusting and I ask the business to rethink that one. Everything else we tried was pretty good, besides the edamame and the Rock N' Roll. Edamame had excess water and left the pods a little slimy. :( My favorite was the Jason hand roll and a long cooked roll that was spicy and had cream cheese. Of course when I do A.Y.C.E. I have to have my salmon skin the bacon of the sea, so I had to have one and it was just right that, so I opted out for dessert. I will be returning and hopefully give more stars.

We made a reservation at 7PM on a Tuesday.  When we arrived, the restaurant was half full.  We were seated in the furthest room in the back behind a wall where we couldn't really enjoy the atmosphere of the restaurant. My expectation would have been to have a nicer table, considering we had made reservations and the restaurant wasn't very busy. 

Our server took 10 minutes to initially greet us (again, his section was only half seated) and took a drink and appetizer order.  We ordered baked oysters as an appetizer and signature cocktails.  The oysters were delicious (best I've had anywhere), but our cocktails didn't show up until we had eaten all of them.

Then, our entrees arrived.  We had shrimp and grits, mussels, fries, and the etouffee.  Whoever dropped off our food didn't ask us if we needed anything else or offer to refill our totally empty waters and cocktails.  We waited patiently for our waiter to come by so that we could have something to drink with our meals. 

When he didn't show up after 10 minutes of letting our food get cold, I was just about to walk up to the bar and seek out a manager, when a woman, who I assume was the manager came by to check on us.  I told her we needed 2 more cocktails, water refills, an empty bowl for the mussel shells, and some ketchup for our fries.  She got everything over to our table in a timely fashion.

Overall, the food was wonderful, it's just too bad that it was tainted with such inattentive service.  Did we eventually get everything we needed to enjoy our meal?  Yes.  Do I feel that a restaurant with such a great reputation should anticipate customers basic needs more successfully?  Absolutely.

Over the next 2 days we ate at several casual restaurants uptown and in the french quarter.  NONE of them had the sterling reputation of Luke.  ALL of them had better service.

Hands down the Best Pizza I've had in St. Louis, whenever my wife and I have pizza needs this is the place we go.  The crust has a great light texture to it given by the cornmeal and the wide variety of gourmet toppings allow you to never repeat the same pizza twice.  The sauce is chunky, well flavored, and piled on high on top of the toppings. My only complaint would be that every once in awhile I feel like they use the delicious sauce to hide a pittance of toppings.  You'll find a moat of gourmet cheese in front of the crust if you add it but nary a hint of it's flavor elsewhere.  But overall the food is excellent, service is friendly, and the atmosphere is nice.

Mona Lisa Latte :) I like the name, and I like the way it tastes!

This place is super cute! Their signature drinks are creative, and tasty. Their coffee is nicely roasted. They have teas (which are made/blended in Seattle, my home town... LOVE) and a nice pastry case! Great ambiance. Pretty stained glass over the door. 

I am so happy I found this place, I just wish I lived closer!

This place is incredibly filthy and I will be contacting the health department :-) 

Service is also the slowest I've ever witnessed.

This place is nothing but hype. There is nothing here that you can't get lots of other places that can prepare and serve it better. And possible cheaper. Perhaps there is an exception: I seriously doubt if you can find a worse breaded tenderloin ANYWHERE in Indiana. Cheese on a tenderloin? Grits? I think the owners need to find out which restaurants in the area do the best example of everything on their metro menu. Then start visiting and tasting. I'm a restaurant management consultant and I give this restaurant a year before word gets around that it sucks. And, it definitely will.

I am a REGULAR Dunkin go-er and this location is absolutely awful. I repeated my order 4 times, the guy taking my order was mumbling and kept saying they didn't have things I was ordering but then suddenly would say "oh yeah we do nevermind", we waited in line for 36 minutes, got to the window, the girl at the window stood and glared at us before opening the window, we finally got out food and none of it was correct. We got 3 things we didn't order and didn't get any of the 4 items we did order. They charged us incorrectly and when (god forbid) we asked for ketchup packets and politely what took so long in the drive thru line, she rolled her eyes and said "were busy". Alrighty then... won't be returning.

We really wanted to like this place... hidden in the neighborhood, outside patio, promise of craft cocktails, under new management.... Unfortunately the service was nonexistent, the food was eh, and the menu was typical with odd (not good) twists throughout. We won't be back.

This is my favorite Cambodian restaurant! Grant it, I've never been to any other Cambodian spot, but I can tell the food here is 5 star quality. 

The entire kitchen and FOH staff are family! I remember talking to the waiter/cashier/everything guy (lol) telling me who made each dish we ordered. One from his grandmother, another from his brother and the last from his mom. I thought that was so cool! 

The food is always fresh and tasty and flavors are balanced. Be careful with ordering spicy unless you can REALLY handle it. I'm a spicy eater, trust I eat the Korean Spicy Noodles just because. Unlike that, these peppers take over your mouth like no other. So just a warning!

To wrap it up, this place is definitely a hidden gem! BYOB! Small and family owned feel. Casual. 

Favorite dishes:
Cha Kr' ung (chicken)
Prah-Hak Kateeh
Called to ensure they'd be open when we arrived. They said they would be. Arrive before their stated closing hours. Lights on, but closed. Two stars for bad service.
Ate twice here during our stay in NOLA. The gator traps are a great appetizer. Chef even came out to chat. The burgers are consistently good here.

This is an excellent restaurant. When you first arrive the outside looks different not your cliche look, but don't let that fool you the food is phenomenal. Great atmosphere and delicious breakfast.... 100 thumbs up
Pamela our server is awesome!!! She made sure to tell us what's popular since we're new to the restaurant!

Better than The Pharmacy (except for the buns) and their shakes are great too. Pleasant and fast service. Little bit pricey for a burger joint but you know that going in if a restaurant is in The Gulch.

This was the worst diner I ever been to in my life. For diners my expectations aren't much so I usually stick to fried foods - frozen food thrown into a fryer not hard to execute right?!?  WRONG!  Ordered shrimp dinner for me OMG shrimp tasted bad and it was soggy. Ordered chicken fingers for my daughter it was so bad we had to send it back (and I'm not a person who really ever sends food back). I would never come here again. Service was just as bad as good.

Best kind of Diner.  Lot of good food, R
Great prices, & nice servers.
I so happily full.  
4 of us.  We all got the sweet potatoes.  Delicious.   You have to have this as one of your sides.

Service is good. Beer is good. Plenty of TV'S to watch sports. Food is below average. Cleanliness of dining areas is way below average. I'm assuming the convenient location is what keeps this place in business.

Tried maple bacon, chocolate glazed, and a chocolate one filled with marshmallow. Perfect cake donut, very tender. The maple flavor was my favorite, and the chocolate was good as well but could have had stronger flavor. Delicious latte.

My husband and I walked over from our hotel because he had read a great review of Soy Teriyaki Bistro on YELP and wanted to try it.    The food was fabulous and the young couple that own the place were wonderful.  We had ordered rice bowls but the owners  offered to let us try other items on the menu.  Overall, it was a perfectly delightful experience!

I ordered a salad here for lunch today and it was delicious! Fresh ingredients and the grilled chicken was juicy and flavorful. I can't wait to try one of their bowls and a smoothie which also looked awesome. My coworker had a stir fry bowl and said it was great. The employees were also super friendly and helpful. 

5 stars, would nom again.

If you want a great sandwich, something uncommonly good, try a Barrio Sandwich! The custom Barrio Bread makes an unbelievable good sandwich coupled with quality ingredients unparalleled in Tucson really. You can tell the chef put real care into the product being served because it's not just any sandwich. I had the Cubano that I would recommend to anyone. But my friend had the focaccia chicken pesto and raved about it. Great experience, fast personal service.  Check it out !

Food is always fresh and hot however they don't seem to work good under pressure. I waited 40 minutes for my food last time I visited this restaurant because they forgot about me. They just need more organization and communication skills amongst each other.

Amazing oysters!!! We had raw, Cleveland baked and Fried.  All were great and tasty!  Matt was our server and he kept the beer coming and the food delivered!  Great and fun guy!!! Super attentive!!  Live music was fun and whole night was a blast!

Been to Tryst several times.....
Great location and luv the decor. Food is typically cooked to perfection for such a small kitchen they do a great job. Luv the cheese plate with drinks. Crab cakes and salmon were excellent.
Never had bad service. It can get busy. i am not sure that a small gem of a place be criticized because it is did not have seats available.

We had a girl's night at Kabobs last week.  We shared kabobs, chicken tika,sambosas, rice and nan.  The nan is freshly made every day.  It was great!  We wrapped it up with Turkish coffee.  It was a delightful dinner with great friends.  Asiz (sp?),the owner was wonderfully friendly as well.  We'll be back!

Today as I was hungry when I went in I was grumpy and tried ordering off SB menus as the menus was upsetting me so I called pizza Meetze directly and they gave me 50% off for the hassle the only downside was I had a drive-in but as I put in my order they got something wrong I ordered a chicken tortilla soup and I ended up getting a minestrone soup for my girlfriend she flashed at me on Valentine's Day because I ruined her valentines night and all she wanted was a chicken tortilla soup now I'm stuck with the minestrone and i'm mad girlfriend thanks a lot pizza Meetze for everything tonight as far as my stomach goes but I'm not getting laid.

I enjoyed my first visit. I hadn't tried any PDQ before. All of the employees we encountered were really pleasant and helpful. I enjoyed my buffalo tender sandwich and recommend adding pickles (if you're into that sort of thing- which I am). The green tea has an interesting flavor to it.... Like a floral flavor, I'd say. Anyway, the restaurant is nice and clean. I'd go back and try more things again.

I was invited by a friend to see a jazz band here a little while back.  I didn't know anything about it but when I got there I was surely impressed.  The Twisted Tail is a two story bar that's giving off that super hip vibe throughout.  There is plenty of space, including many tables, a long bar, and some smaller tables near the stage.  I like that the place was nice and busy but not overly crowded.  

I ordered drinks and food.  The food was super delicious!  I really enjoyed the mac and cheese and empanadas.  The food is a bit pricey, but worth it if you don't mind splurging.  They also have a great beer selection, something that I always look for in a good bar.  On top of that, the band was great and I was happy to see them.  Will definitely be back.

My wife and I will end up making our plans around going here for lunch. We will literally say "hey you wanna go to Tilles park and then pick up some food at forest Perk cafe??" It is quite sad and awesome all at once because we both know we just want to go to the Cafe. They have some really great food and it is not bad price wise. 

I usually get the pick 2 salad and sandwich because regardless they serve you what seems like the same amount of salad so you really get a good deal. The Caesar dressing is really nice to, something different from your normal Caesar dressing. The 3 cheese and ham hot sandwich is awesome also. 

Also the strawberry yogurt parfait is the bee's knees. We always get the parfait, I mean always. 

I love that it is so small and you can see them making your food. Also the employees are always helpful and very attentive. 

I am not a coffee drinker so I cannot attest to the quality or taste of anything other than the food and the food is Delicious. 

Definitely a great place to stop in a have lunch. I love the outside seating also, very peaceful and they have nice tables with umbrellas. When it is not so freakishly hot we sit out there and enjoy the day.

Highly recommended.

Wow! Tried this place for dinner based on the exemplary Yelp and Trip Advisor reviews, and it lived up to the hype. Family owned and operated, the server was friendly and enthusiastic, and the food was super flavorful and obviously cooked with heart. I went for the chicken platter because I like to try as many things as I can -- curried chicken, brown chicken and jerk chicken, with plantains, peas and rice and a salad. The flavors of each of the hearty portions complimented each other in perfect harmony. And the food was unbelievably fast -- even for our table of 6. We all really enjoy our meals and our evening. Caribbean for dinner? Yah Mon!!
Awesome pizza ! We order there everytime. Great friendly service. We are new yorker and chicago people. And we seal for approval!

This place is truly one of the best restaurants in Philadelphia.

The food comes straight from the cooking talents of a Cambodian grandmother and is, fresh, unique, and ultimately incredibly delicious. There are so many dishes that are absolutely fantastic that it is hard to narrow down and recommend one over the other. I really enjoy the papaya salad each time I go, but it's the primary entrees that steal the show.

It is not the biggest place in the world, but the service is OUTSTANDING, and the family atmosphere with which the ownership runs the business is really great. We went with a group of 7 recently and had to wait for a half hour or so, but it was a weekend and the fact that it is BYO made our wait very easy to get through. 

This place is worth going to regardless of where you live in or outside of the city. I love Khmer Kitchen and will miss it when we leave Philly.
I used yelp to find this place, we drove from Oxnard it was totally worth the drive!!! Everything we got here was AMAZING from coffee to the jelly! Do yourself a favor and eat here.

Yum, yum and more yum. 

My husband and I were in NOLA with our 6- and 9-year old children. We found this place on YELP. The place was lovely, with an elegant decor that welcomed both dressy and casual. The staff was lovely, and we had a wonderful time. The b-b-q shrimp is delish. The pecan crusted puppy drum is wonderful. The desserts were to die for. Overall it was a great experience and the best meal we had in New Orleans.

Sunday Funday! The patio is amazing, drinks are solid, and Erin the server is extremely attentive to any wants and needs you may have! They had live music inside and Erin opened one of the patio doors so we could listen and enjoy the beautiful weather. She is fabulous and we love her!

After the experience I had last night, I'm highly disappointed. Usually I would go in for a drink or two but last night I decided on food. Big mistake. All their food sounds good but almost none of it lives up to the hype. I had 'The Rocky' sandwich, which was alright (composed of Italian meats) but not earth shattering. My house fried potato chips wee terrible, totally soggy, and I'd been so looking forward to them. My boyfriend had a bad experience with his calimari (said it was rubbery) and the bartender messed up his drink order (got an IPA instead of the wheat he ordered and was thoroughly disgusted, as we aren't IPA people at all). The place is nice inside, but oddly laid out, and if you're sitting at a table you're nearly forgotten. I wanted to like Nook's, and I do for a drink, but eating there is no longer an option. What a shame.

Luke was hit or miss for us. 
First, dress well even though the food is really casual, because we felt really out of place in jeans and casual tops because this is that kind of restaurant/style of food in Chicago, but apparently everyone just dresses well in the south...

Food is fine here. Just execution wasn't up to my expectations of a restaurant of this price point/ambiance/reputation... Like, shells and grit in 4 of our 12 oysters?!, unevenly cooked vegetable in our salad (which they split for us because we were splitting everything; that was a nice touch), really really salty and overcooked shriveled mussels we had to send back because for $30 I hoped to get really great mussels and broth... They kindly made some sauce for my fries to dip into, but it came back underseasoned! 

Our favorite was the pan fried fresh gulf fish, which was cooked really well and had nice simple clean flavors and accompaniments that went well overall. 

Our server was a nice guy, but a bit absent and awkward? Had trouble answering our questions and did not deal with the mussels with the hospitality I hoped. I kept reading about great service here, but we ended up having to ask a floater who kept filling in for things (additional orders, our utensils replaced, our check). It was a bit of a bummer, because good service could have really saved our night despite food not being up to our expectations.

A little disappointed by how many things could be done better if they're charging this much for food. Glad we came, but would not recommend to friends who are visiting. August looked really good when we walked by though! Maybe next time we're in town...

I have been coming here since I moved in 2014.

They have the BEST food in town, the BEST beer, and the UP MOST BEST customer service!! I have never came and left disappointed. 

I used to work at the brewery right next door and I always left mine to come to the Depot! If you are new in town or visiting this a must stop by.

They have some awesome Tshirts and hats too!

Everything was delicious!  Ground Beef Tacos, Chicken Fajitas,  Nachos, Shrimp Tacos. The only odd thing was that the fajitas didn't come with rice, however it did come with beans. Also chips and salsa cost an additional $1.50 for refills... weird. Anyways, try the spicy meatball soup, really good!

I mean, it's a fine casino, but there isn't much else to do besides gamble and stop at a bar.

It lacks the shops and dining experiences offered by most modern casinos.  

However, there are tables with low minimum bets if that is your thing.
Came for the tom ka, but the phad se ew was incredible. Can't go wrong with the tom ka though. Actually has galangal unlike most places I've found. I'm going as far to say the best in tampa!

I was so thrilled to be able to get a great gyros sandwich when Kalamatas opened some years back. But the last three times I've been there (2015-2016) have been disappointing. I don't know what happened. The lamb should be heated -- not. The pita should be warm -- not. I had heard that the owner is no longer on site and gone to another restaurant. Fine, except I think people currently in the kitchen may need more training.
Great food, very authentic. I liked that they did not hold back on the spice-level. Not much choice for beers, I'd give it a five stars because they had Kingfisher, a staple Indian beer.
Good food, but the guy who cooks it is kind of an ass. Everyone else has wonderful customer service.
Came to have a drink before an event! Great little lounge area, attentive staff and reasonable prices.. would've loved to see the view but it was very foggy! Would Love to go back for dinner!

It's nice to have a new dining option near he Belcourt Theater. I was intrigued by the concept of burgers and sushi since I spend a lot of time with a picky friend who usually won't go near a sushi restaurant.  So, we stopped by Sunday night.  Both the burger guy and sushi eaters among us were pleased with the food--it wasn't particularly notable, but it wasn't bad.  We ended up being seated on the enclosed patio, which gave us about zero ambiance on a cold winter's night. Our server was great, so that was a plus.  Bottom line, I will definitely try this place again, hopefully inside the actually restaurant, or on the patio during the summer. It won't, however, be my destination when I want great sushi.

This is my favorite place to lunch solo. The people who work here are so friendly, and the falafel is always wonderful & freshly made. Plus it's such a deal for how much food you get. Did I mention I love this place?

One of the best Dosa and filter coffee(too good) I ever had. Very creative Dosa range, we had Basil Dosa and it was yum.. My friends were drooling over chicken biryani.
Very economic meal, owner is very cool and nice guy. The place needs some uplift  in terms of infrastructure but owner mentioned he is looking for some funding

It's Olive Garden! It's unlimited salad and bread sticks! It's pasta the way they want you to think Italy makes it! I won't knock them too hard, because I typically do enjoy Olive Garden. The food quality is fine, the service is generally friendly, and the bill is relatively modest unless you go insane with drink orders.

This is where you go when you want Italian, but you don't need the "experience" of the more renowned places in St. Louis. It's good, and I'll keep going back and enjoying myself until it proves otherwise.
Sitting in the downstairs bar and they refuse to close the door. It's freezing out and 60 degrees in the restaurant. They don't care people are walking out because it's cold
Amazing food! Had breakfast there a few days back and both the food and service were great! Super quick at a reasonable prive

Had a working lunch here for a large group of consultants.  I made a reservation the morning of as soon as they opened to let them know I'd be there at noon with 18 people.  It was no problem and they had a table all ready for us when we arrived. 

Ordering was very easy, drinks were refilled before they were empty, and our food was hot when it was delivered to the table. It was also delicious.

This place is really great for large groups as well as is family friendly if you're coming with just a few people.

Went here on Monday night. Ambiance is OK, pretty nice for an Amtrak station. The beer selection isn't good - but they have a few decent taps. Food is good, not spectacular. Oh, and it's expensive. Beer is $5-6 a pint, not terrible, though. Overall a decent time but not a landmark.

BFF really is a nice addition to Reno. A favorite among athletes and people getting their premade healthy lunch fix. Good staff, and the peanut butter balls are legitimately really good, albeit not that healthy, but still... really good.

I visited Chateau Coffee a couple of times for a quick iced coffee fix, and experienced not-so-delightful exchanges with one person on the staff. She was just short and rude. So, when my dad came into town this was the last place I wanted to take him. Well, I am glad he pushed it because we ended up going several times during his three week stay. The food is surprisingly delicious... mmmm French Dip, and the service got better with each visit. There are a lot of regulars in here for lunch daily, as it is a neighborhood staple/hangout. Turns out the girl that I thought was not so great is there almost every day too, and she never stops working.. she is also really kind. If you are in the Lakeview/Lakeshore area stop in and give this place a shot!
Just a great bar, with great staff. We end up here a lot during the week for lunch, and it's always consistently good. Now, I need to get more into soccer.

Ok let me start by saying love the vibe and the people working there now with that being said the pasta was inedible.  Italian food is my favorite and I  have never has anything quite like that.  The pasta was spaghetti  and when you would pick up a noodle the entire thing was stuck together is was like a pile of chewing gum.  It's as simple as learning how to boil noodles!

A first. 2:17 on a Sunday, walked in and there where honestly as many empty tables as there were taken. We counted at least 18 empty tables plus multiple high tops. The hostess actually looked at us and told us the wait was at least 30 minutes. I was stunned, laughed, thought she was actually kidding. She wasn't. I asked if she was expecting 29 tables worth of people to all walk in in the next 30 minutes. We left.

Continue. So we went across the street to Yard House. Please see that review

I went last year and food and service was wonderful. Came back today with high expectations. Awful!! Ordered the eggs Benedict like last year. 1. Last year eggs Benedict was spicy, buttery and super delicious. Today, super salty, not spicy, inedible. The waiter didn't even offer the option of chicory coffee but he was nice. I tasted my daughter's pancake. Had a weird aftertaste. DON'T ORDER THE EGGS BENEDICT OR PANCAKES.

The COCHON DE LAIT  PRESSED SANDWICH was absolutely delicious. I can't wait to go back and try some of the other yelp recommendations. The service was excellent but the restaurant wasn't crowded for an early Saturday lunch. I would rate it a five star but I have only tried one item so far.

Extremely tranquil atmosphere in a great spot in St. Petersburg. Interesting, tasty menu. The seafood mofungo was a real treat and had far less fat than the traditional mofuno. Best of all for such a nice place, the prices are reasonable! We'll keep coming back!

Food is always top notch, great selection and generous portions. Could use some renos but not a big issue.

Will be returning

This is my new favorite place!! I savored every bite of my sandwich, potato salad and awesome chocolate chip cookie.

Today I had lunch here and ordered the Cuban sandwich with red potato salad side. The bread I was told was baked fresh here and it tasted like it was. VERY tender and juicy pork, very well made potato salad and the presentation was nice. Lunch was affordable especially for the fresh quality. My chocolate chip cookie was very decently sized and had a nice balance of soft and crumbly. Get a chocolate chip cookie here, you won't regret it! I think I'll head back now and get one for later.

My server was very nice and so was everyone else working here. There were a few interesting paintings for sale on the wall; the music was good too. A friend also told me about the ham and cheese stuffed croissants that I will need to get next time as well as the bread. MMMM!

Words can simply not describe the breath-taking view created by Animal Planet's "Tanked" team. While staying at the Guy Harvey Outpost at the TradeWinds, we wanted to experience RumFish Grill. Our servers were very attentive and offered their favorite dinner suggestions. I started with the Organic Garden Salad made with watermelon and feta was light and refreshing. Per our servers' suggestions, my husband and I both ordered the Grouper Picatta which was excellent and very fresh, however, it was the incredible selection of desserts that nearly upstaged the massive aquarium. The Pineapple Rum Tiramisu was a slice of island paradise.

"The Cave" allows a viewing opportunity without having to dine in the restaurant. My family and I were mesmerized by sting rays swimming over our heads.

For a table near the tank, reservations are advised. A reasonably priced kid's menu with GF, vegetarian and healthy options is available.
Very decent Taiwanese food considering it's located in Reno where I have not found good Chinese food.

Overpriced Salad was the best part of dining experience by far. After appetizer,  one Salad, and a few drinks with tip bill was $80.  No problem there.  However, while being a paying customer and sitting outside we were asked to get up and move tables because another "Party" had reservations. Still consuming our Overpriced drinks mind you.  The manager lady was not pleasant at all, and then, after we agreed to move to accomdate the more important paying customers our original sever acted like we never gave her the check receipt...absolutely appalling!  As someone who works in restaurants every day, trust me, there are much better options nearby.
This place was phenomenal!  The staff were great and the food was tremendous. The "Nasty Princess" was cooked to perfection!!!!    And the blueberry French toast WHEWEEEEE. FANTASTIC!!!

Great food... But the service is terrible. Waited 30 minutes for pulled pork. Just for them to come out and say they dropped our order on the floor. After we decided we would just leave, we tried waving down a waitress. Four of them walked right past us as we stood in front of the kitchen. Finally I yelled "hey" at one who was standing two feet in front of me... To which she just ran back to the kitchen. The service is a joke and they are only still open because it's a small town with limited options. Also, during our wait, none of the tables were cleaned off and there were flies hovering all around. It was pretty disgusting in itself. Hope this helps!
Very delicious food and great prices too.  Try the cookies, very healthy!!    If you have to wait  for a table you can wait across the street and have coffee and they will come and get you.

AMAZING AMAZING!  great atmosphere and staff and even better food!  I honestly can't remember the names of the pizzas we all had (big table and lots of sharing) but they all were amazing!  My favorite had the pizza sauce on top of the toppings and you could tell it was freshly made sauce not out of a can.

This is a great deli on the water for breakfast and lunch.  We have loved everything we have tried.  Probably the best breakfast/lunch place on Sand Key.  If you are staying at one of the hotels - skip their frozen/microwaved version of food and try Shorty's.  Super nice people and reasonable prices too

Definitely WAY overrated. Also a tad over-priced. "Hipster" friendly scene though.

The wine list looked better than it was. Reminded me of the days when I first got into wine and didn't really know much other than, "there's red and there's white." And that's pretty much the wine options Tria gave; red or white (nothing special about them).

The food was EXTREMELY disappointing as well. I don't know if the chef was having an off day or what. But the food was just sloppy and not thought out. Flavors clashing evrywhere... it was upsetting.

- Roasted Beets with Bulgarian Feta Cheese: Just some beets and feta cheese thrown on a plate.
- Tuscan Three Cheese Potato Chips with Smoked Paprika Aioli: Actually doesn't come with the aioli, according to the waitress. The chips were tasty, but you only are served two chips per person.
- Gorgonzola with Fig Jam Bruschetta: Too much fig jam, not enough gorgonzola. I love fig jam too... but they slathered way too much on.
- Smoked Mozzarella, Crispy Prosciutto & Tomato Brushetta: Best dish we got. The vinaigrette on top was very good.
- Tomato Brushchetta: It looked like this dish was literally made by a young kid. The tomato was all cut WAY too big for bruschetta, making it very messy and sloppy to eat. Only good part was the vinaigrette on top.

On the plus side, we had a very prompt and friendly waitress. But I'd just skip Tria and go somewhere worth it.

Only a crazy person would take a huge party here, when the group was known to include many vegans. It happened. It wasn't my fault. I went along to enjoy my allotment of tasty meats.

Thank gosh the salad bar is so diverse and fresh. Otherwise, half our group would have starved.

We always get consistent service and enjoy ourselves. Just be warned, this place is about meat, meat, and more meat. Vegans stay away.

Had a phenomenal time... Cuba, Gabriel, and Mattie are the best... That's bartenders in Florida... Belly up. Very hospitable and wonderful drinks. Constant helping out. It's a must to go here. Nightly specials.

Good food, great service from Meaghan. The place is a little pricey. Because it's in a popular tourist area the dining area can get busy, which means it's best to get a reservation. We sat in the bar area because it was open. On busy weekends the entire area is a traffic nightmare, but Rum Fish has its own parking area so no problems there. Great place for tourists, ok for locals.

This is a really great spot. I've been here for every occasion; dates, family dinners, groups and girls nights. I have never ordered anything bad. The staff here are fantastic. I love when a server gets excited about the food they have. I've had some great conversations with different servers each time I've dined here. The ambience is dark, rustic with industrial light fixtures. It's a hip spot with friends, yet intimate and romantic for a date. I've had an amazing burger here. I've tried a few of the specials, including an awesome lobster mac n cheese. Most recently I had the pork and dumplings. It was excellent. Melt in your mouth. They always have fresh seasonal salads. Always get bread here. That is the one thing I stress.

Found this McDonalds busy but very adequate.  Clean, with plenty of seating.  The only negatives were the $ menu was very small and placed in the far left of non-lit area and there was no calories listed for any items, and they failed to ask if we wanted the apple pie.  Aside from that 3 stars is appropriate.

As good as downtown without the downtown parking fiasco.  Love Sauce.  I always get the Duke, because BBQ sauce/chicken/bacon/mozzarella is never a bad combo.  Its not the cheapest, but you walk out needing a wheelbarrow (in a good way, of course!). I've brought bosses, friends, dates here...not at the same time...that'd be awkward.

Nutshell:  its ALLLL good.  All of it.  People are down to earth, food is flavorful and filling.  Can't go wrong for lunch or dinner.

Really, really enjoyed myself here. Went with a group of 5 friends and shared a ton of tapas. Nobody was really drinking that night, save for the lonestar who went out on a limb and ordered the sangria (which was pretty good, nothing special). You've gotta admire the one partygoer who breaks the chain of water ordering to go with the alcoholic beverage. ANYWAYS, here's what I'd recommend if you make it out to Modesto:
-Make a reservation if you have a group of more than 4.
-Order the bacon-wrapped dates. I mean, anything that begins with "bacon-wrapped" is okay in my book, but the combo is great (if not terribly unique) and everyone at the table devoured them. 
-Utilize your bread. Ask for extra. Lots of the dishes have amazing sauces and broths (think Mussels, Cauliflower- both of which you should get) and you've gotta sop it up with the bread. 
-Don't hustle for a patio seat. The outdoor seating isn't that exceptional, and I think it'd probably be better in terms of ambiance to sit indoors. 

I'll definitely make a trip back here to get some more of that cauliflower. and pork belly. I mean, everything was pretty tasty, if not OMG 5 STARZ level. If I could give 4.5 stars, I totally would. This is a great place for a date or with a small group (I don't like doing tapas with huge groups because it's hard for everybody to get a bite of each plate). The service was good, no complaints. Glad to have found a new go-to in STL!

As a person lives in LA, it's always good to find some authentic asian food when you're out of town.  Surprisingly good beef noodle (love the soup base) and stinky toufu.  My wife has the oyster pancake which has too much flour and not enough oyster according to her.  We went during lunch time and the place is half full with all locals.  Even the small parking lot is full, it was easy to find parking on the street.  No problem to go back if visiting Reno again.
Awesome food. The service is always on point and the sushi really solid. Favorite place in town. Highly recommend
A breath of fresh air in the lunch scene around here.  Excellent noodles.  Delicious healthy fare. I will be coming here regularly.

Came here by myself when I was traveling, hadn't been to Hyde Park in almost 20 years so seemed like a fun destination. 

I sat at the bar and had a drink while I looked at the menu. The bartenders were friendly and chatty without being too invasive.

I ordered a steak and risotto according to one of the bartender's suggestions.

I've had much better steaks at "non steakhouse" restaurants. The chopped salad had been chopped a while before, the cherry tomatoes were soft and wilted. The risotto was very bland. 

The men's room had a very wet floor--you can guess what the wetness was from. Nasty. 

Nice staff, cool jazz combo, nice atmosphere. The $90 tab for a steak, a couple of sides and a couple drinks made it not even close to worth it for me. I'd come for a drink and to listen to the music, but I wouldn't eat here again.
I'd been dying to eat here.  I had the tostones rellenos and ordered the Hemingway Cuban with garlic tostones to take home.  Everything was  amazing.  This is my favorite spot at Armature Works

Drove by hungry and saw a "restaurant and bar" sign and decided to stop in. Needless to say, I am very glad we did. The food was beyond amazing. I had the fried chicken and Mac and cheese and she had the oxtail fries and spicy tuna nachos. Everything tastes great and fresh. Drinks were great also. Nice selection of cocktails and draft beer. Bourbon and Branch is definitely going on my list of go to places and very high up on it.
This is my favorite sushi in town. Good quality and a good price. Staff is all very nice and love the traditional shoes of tables. They're uni is great which is hard to fine.

Might have been a decent place but the 3 ladies working the food section were by far the rudest waitresses/cooks/staff (wI've ever encountered in any establishment.  I love trying new places and hoped to order food and a drink but I literally wondered if maybe they were foreigners and didnt understand English well cause they were simply rude, unsocial, and ignored me when I tried to make polite conversation and order food.  I just left, never to return.

I've gone twice now with my daughter (2.5 y/o) on Saturday mornings. While I've waited an hour both times, we've enjoyed our brunch both times. I'm still  rocking pregnancy, but am certain their mimosas and cocktails are great (will try post-baby)! My daughter loves their pancakes; they are seriously the best with a perfect sprinkle of cinnamon sugar on top. Five stars right there. I've gone with both the omelette and French toast and have loved them both. I plan on working down the menu over the course of this year while I'm working in the area.

Our group ordered a dozen oysters and shared several of the small plates. We loved our waitress and the floor manager was attentive and pleasant. The restaurant and hotel have a unique atmosphere, but doesn't feel as if they've tried too hard to be cool. It's a beautifully restored space and the food is amazing.

Food was great very friendly staff, I celebrated my birthday with brunch there and I accidently left my birthday present there and when I called to see if they found it "No one had seen it". I thought that was a bit shady.  But other than that visit was great!

Very good pho! One of the best broths in Edmonton. Bright natural lighting. Excellent service and seemed very clean on the front end. 

Another plus is they serve western food if you are in the mood for pho and someone you are with wants a burger. They also have all day breakfast.

My wife took our kids to bathrooms which she said where gross and stunk. A good cleaning would be advised. Kitchens looked very clean though from what I could see poking my head around the corner.

Been getting takeout from here a lot lately. It's such a tiny place you wouldn't even know it's there but we've been hearing a lot about it and as you can see from the reviews, it's gaining a lot of attention. The takeout has been extremely fast and all of the food has been extremely fresh and delicious.

Stopped here for a quick bite to eat, and loved it. Nothing fancy, but very cute! Prices were great too. The staff was amazingly kind. They gave great recommendations, were very accommodating, very attentive, and kept the place clean. I'd recommend anyone come here for a quick bite midday! The seafood omelette was delish, as well as the strawberry banana malts!

Best Chinese food in the area! Just spoke with them and they will reopen in a couple months! (Waiting on money from insurance for the fire damage grrrrrr) I'll be waiting (impatiently) for my chongqing chicken.

We had 12 for dinner. All enjoyed themselves. Good service. Chose this because right near Independence Mall for a quick sightsee, then dinner, with a return to hotels. Relatively safe walk back.
Order the Pork Loin, Lasagna, Pasta w/vodka sauce, and sit back. Calimari were good, so were many appetizers--didn't like the salads, too much dressing. Good happy-hour prices too.
Liked the deserts as well. $57 pp, w/drinks and tip.

Lascelles is another restaurant located within walking distance of the cinema in downtown Granite City.  The restaurant is inside an old bank building directly across from City Hall. 

The tomato bisque is outstanding. It comes with two small pieces of a grilled cheese sandwich. I order this ever time I go to this restaurant. 

Lascelles has a great special. It consists of a 16 oz steak, a 16 oz baked potato, and a 16 oz beer for $16. 

The dress code for this restaurant is casual and you can normally get a table without a wait.  I would recommend this restaurant.

Service was atrocious.  There is a really nice bartender that is usually working when I go there but this time it was a very attractive asian girl that gave all her attention to the men at the bar.  I, on the other hand, received no attention; my wine was never topped up, I was never asked if I wanted to order food (I did) and I needed to call her over to order another glass of wine.  Very disappointing.

I've enjoyed Mellow Mushroom Birmingham  and various places in Florida, so was excited to have one in town. I think this location took a little while to get its groove, but is now producing product worthy of the Mellow reputation.

I also love be that they now deliver. 

The kids love the pizza and pretzels and my daughter and I are devoted to the "Holy Shitake:" a white pizza with mushrooms, herbs and spiral of ridiculous truffle aioli. Yum! 
The crust in their pizza has a great chew and a lot of flavor: yeasty with a touch of what I suspect is molasses. 

Oh, and I'm a fan of the mushroom soup. It's warming, rich and earthy. Great comfort food!

Absolutely fantabulous! This place has an amazing beer selection, cool place to hang out, and stellar deep-dish pizza. The pizza wasn't so thick that it would fill you up in one bite, which was actually a great thing! More flavors to enjoy and time to sit sipping suds with your dining companions. Highly recommended!

Have been going to this Panera for a steady week now being on vacation in this area.
Panera is a great place, good selection, good coffee etc
